reviews.content: It was the best action movie I saw. I really congratulate all the actors of this movie. There were very difficult stunts in this movie, although it is said that Keanu did most of the stunts himself, but it is not believable. One of the wonders of this movie is its lighting. And it was very good that this four-part movie ended with all its excitement and the peace they considered for John was very appropriate and acceptable with all the hardships he went through and the people he lost along the way. I hope that if part 5 of this series is made, they will provide a very good and acceptable reason because it could not be better than this.
reviews.heading: In the top 250 movies

reviews.content: Each John Wick movie innovated upon the last and tried to bring new action scenes and choreography to the table. After 3 movies you think they'd be running out of steam, but they manage to up the game again.Without giving anything away, the pacing is good. The start is pretty relentless, the middle has some story building and the final third goes from one wonderfully shot sequence to the next, it was a joy to watch and so well pulled off - not a single piece of shakey cam in this movie. Just clear, believable performances given by dedicated actors and coordinators. I know months of training goes into these types of sequences, especially from Keeanu who even at a high tier will feel he can improve upon it.The storyline is fairly decent, we see other talented actors like Hiroyuki Sanada (great with a sword) and Donnie Yen. There's also a big moment story-wise which probably helps set up The Continental (a mini series this autumn) but I won't say anything about this, the viewer will have to watch it.Overall, a great movie, it doesn't really feel too much like a rehash as brings some new ideas and cinematography to the table. I hope in time we will get more from Keeanu & Chad Stahelski (in whatever form or new IP that may be).
reviews.heading: It's not often the final movie is the best

reviews.content: I felt so much bored after the first 90 min.Unnecessary long, some seens are beyond logic.Good that this is the last chapter. I wasted almost three hours and I regret that. I thought after 40 min of watching whether this is a new Marvel character!!I could not understand the critic's review or some viewers reviews whom gave a rating above 3 on what basis they gave a such rating.I liked John Wick Part 1, it was a new kind if action, Part 2 was an entertaining story, Part 3 started to feel bored and should end the series in this Part.I hope to see Keanu Reeves with a better movies as I like him.
reviews.heading: Not as expected

reviews.content: John Wick 1 was the best imo. The story was somewhat coherent and drew attention. There was plenty of action that was exciting without being over-the-top ridiculous.Next up in John Wick 2, the story was still somewhat coherent and though some scenes started to become a bit nonsensical(tons of assassins and no police etc), it was still a solid movie and easy to follow.In John Wick 3 everything took a nosedive into utter nonsense. Part 4 expanded on this with nothing but lots of ridiculous wild nonstop fights. Typical Hollywood cash grabs devolved into absolute boring and ridiculous rubbish.
reviews.heading: Ridiculous

reviews.content:
From start to finish, this movie delivers an adrenaline-fueled experience that will leave you breathless. The action is intense, with each fight scene being expertly choreographed and executed. The action set pieces are some of the most memorable I've ever seen, with each one being more jaw-dropping than the last.One of the standout aspects of John Wick 4 is the villains. This time around, they are more interesting than ever, with big-name actors bringing their A-game to their respective roles. It's always great to see veteran actors like Keanu Reeves and Laurence Fishburne on screen, but the addition of newcomers like Bill Skarsgard and Donnie Yen really elevates the movie.But perhaps the real star of John Wick 4 is the fight cinematography. The one-take fight scene that was filmed from overhead is a work of art. It's so seamless and fluid that you feel like you're right there in the middle of the action. The attention to detail in every fight scene is astounding, with each punch and kick feeling like it has real weight behind it.One slight negative of the movie is that John Wick doesn't have much development. However, this is a minor quibble, as the movie is so focused on delivering incredible action that the lack of character development doesn't really matter. After all, John Wick is at his best when he's kicking ass, and he certainly does that in spades in this movie.Overall, John Wick 4 is a fantastic entry in the series. The sense of finality that permeates throughout the movie is perfect, and it really feels like a fitting end to the story. If you're a fan of action movies, then John Wick 4 is an absolute must-see. It's a thrilling ride that will leave you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.Score: 93%
Verdict: Excellent.
reviews.heading: John Wick 4 is an absolute masterpiece of an action film

reviews.content:
It is a movie that will never be repeated, with its defects and advantages, whoever wants it and father from father

reviews.heading: Nice

reviews.content: It was an ENORMOUS let down. Story "edited" many major aspects of the first 3 just so they could make a 4th for $. Much much more of the stupid bulletproof 3 piece suits where no one has massive blunt force trauma from repeated hits. Needlessly added a new potential future dog handler just to continue the series. Another bounty where John is attacked across a major city by the hundreds of unknown bad guys with zero police presence. Just drivel !!! But what should I expect from a sequel who's whole premise is based off a guy who lives from a gunshot AND a 21 story fall. Don't try harder just please stop here !!
reviews.heading: Garbage

reviews.content:
Well, of course I had to sit down and watch the 2023 movie "John Wick: Chapter 4" from director Chad Stahelski, as I have thoroughly enjoyed the previous three movies.Writers Shay Hatten, Michael Finch and Derek Kolstad put together a good enough storyline. Well, with this being a "John Wick" movie, then of course you know that the narrative is not really the driving force here, it is the abundance of action. The storyline is fairly okay, take it for what it is, and just enjoy the action.And an abundance of action there was to be seen in "John Wick: Chapter 4", that was for certain. Maybe even a bit too much actually, because running at 169 minutes, it was a long, long movie. And it was getting a bit tedious towards the last 30 minutes or so to sit through. I mean, even while the action sequences are nicely choreographed and feels like a nicely orchestrated dance sequence, then it got repetitive to watch John Wick waltz almost unscathed through hordes of gunmen and putting one bullet in the head of one after another. Don't get me wrong, it was definitely good entertainment, and I was genuinely entertained, but the movie was long."John Wick: Chapter 4" has a good cast ensemble. Of course it is nice to see Keanu Reeves return to the role of John Wick, and he was joined by other returning actors such as Laurence Fishburne, Lance Reddick and Ian McShane. The movie also have some nice performances and appearances by the likes of Clancy Brown,
Donnie Yen, Bill Skarsgård, Shamier Anderson and Hiroyuki Sanada. Now, Bill Skarsgård was an interesting choice for the main villain in "John Wick: Chapter 4", and he did a good job, though his attempt of a French-English accent was a bit all over the place.Visually then "John Wick: Chapter 4" is quite good, as it has been throughout all of the previous movies as well. I was especially pleased with the sequence that took place inside an old building where you see the action from a bird's view, top-down. That was such a blast of a sequence.This is an action movie, first and foremost. And you are in for a treat of action, because "John Wick: Chapter 4" is nearly 169 minutes of non-stop action. Don't think realism into the picture when you sit down to watch this movie, because realism is way out the window. Just lean back, have your snacks ready and enjoy the non-stop action roller coaster.I was genuinely entertained by the movie, I will say that, though the movie could have benefitted a bit from a more extensive trim in the editing room.All in all, a good fourth movie in a very enjoyable franchise all together. My rating of "John Wick: Chapter 4" lands on a seven out of ten stars. The movie is worth an eight star rating, but the long playtime sort of felt like an anchor around the overall enjoyment of the movie, and thus drags it down to a seven star rating for me.
reviews.heading: Action, more action, and then even more action...

reviews.content: The hype for this movie is on another level...It seems John Wick gains fall-damage immunity at the end of Chapter 3.The falls he survives are insane!Bad guys die instantly from lesser falls in the movie, but John just gets up, shrugs it off, and starts shooting like nothing happened.Every scene is meticulously made, but it's blurred behind the shower of bullets fired every milisecond.In a big city scene, the fight is on throughout the city. John is killing bounty hunters, but there are no COPS to be found.If you like shooting RPGs, you should watch it. Some scenes at the beginning have sloppy hand to hand fights, but they get better during the movie if you don't walk out before the end.
reviews.heading: Overrated movie

reviews.content: I was able to focus on John Wick itself thanks to the ridiculous but easily convincing worldview of John Wick's movie. In particular, the action that is tightly packed without a break even during the long running time makes me hold my breath and makes me unable to let go of the tension. Rather than creating a resistance to this push-up action, John Wick's desperate appearance of life approached us, third observers, recreationally through action, and eventually made us burst into a cheerful laugh like a tracker.It is a film that focuses on the fun of the action genre and captures it lightly and neatly.
reviews.heading: Life is a comedy from a distance and a comedy from a close distance.

reviews.content: Alright, buckle up, folks! We've got a wild ride ahead of us with "John Wick: Chapter 4"! This movie is like a high-octane thrill ride that never lets up, with Keanu Reeves reprising his role as the legendary assassin John Wick.First things first, the action scenes are absolutely insane! From the opening sequence to the final showdown, the fight choreography is top-notch and will leave you on the edge of your seat. It's like a symphony of bullets, punches, and kicks that will make your heart race and your adrenaline pump.But it's not just mindless action, folks. The story is actually pretty darn good too! Without giving away any spoilers, let's just say that John Wick has some serious scores to settle and he's not messing around. The plot is full of twists and turns, and you'll never know what's coming next.And let's not forget about the supporting cast. And don't even get me started on the new additions to the franchise, like Donnie Yen and Hiroyuki Sanada. These guys are absolute badasses and bring a whole new level of intensity to the movie.Overall, "John Wick: Chapter 4" is a wild, action-packed ride that will leave you breathless. It's got everything you could want in an action movie - amazing fight scenes, a killer story, and a fantastic cast. So grab some popcorn, buckle up, and get ready to witness one of the most epic action movies of all time!
reviews.heading: John Wick: chapter 4 - The ultimate Action-Packed thrill RIDE!

reviews.content: Wow, that was something. John Wick: Chapter 4 exceeds at what makes this franchise so sensational. Action scene after action scene, with plenty of gore mixed with a (surprisingly) good story.Despite the long runtime this is Mr. Wick's grandest film, in a near perfect action tetralogy, with an ending that perfectly fits the film. Sad, yet necessary, and the execution is next to flawless.The only thing that could ruin this is a fifth installment. Come on, Hollywood I'm praying you don't try to make some easy money on an unnecessary film.My only recommendation to you is to watch this film before it leaves theaters. You won't regret it, I promise.
reviews.heading: Exceptional conclusion to a great action franchise

reviews.content: *spoilers ahead*Long time action movie buff here. I went into this film having watched the previous 3 John Wicks and thinking that I knew what to expect. I was wrong.This movie is incredibly tedious. The fight scenes, while choreographed well, are nothing new and they drag on and become extremely repetitive over the three hour run time.This is not helped by the fact that everyone now wears magical kevlar suits that stop bullets, so now Wick gets to shoot people 4-5 times each without effect before finally closing in and either shooting or stabbing them in the head.That brings me to my next point. This movie asks for a RIDICULOUS amount of suspension of disbelief from the audience.The most outrageous example perhaps being that we are supposed to accept that Donnie Yens character is blind and yet can somehow outshoot and out swordfight trained assassins over and over again. HOW exactly?Then there was John Wicks ability to absorb superhuman levels of damage (whether falling from a building or being hit by cars, it has about as much effect as hitting him with a pool noodle) This, combined with the bulletproof suit made him seemingly invincible.The movie culminates with John Wick spending about 20 minutes casually mowing down a hundred or so men very publicly in the heart of Paris, many in front of passing vehicles at a major landmark. Apparently there are no police in Paris, as none ever show up.When John Wick fell down the stairs I chuckled, but then groaned in synch with the character as I realised that he now had to fight his way back up again. At that point I really just wanted the movie to end.Neither the plot or script is smart or witty, the action was repetitive and I could not suspend my disbelief enough to enjoy the film. As a result I spent a large portion of the run time thinking "HE'S BLIND JUST SHOOT HIM!"It was a real struggle to sit through this one.
reviews.heading: Tedious and unbelievable

reviews.content: While I feel that the first three films were topnotch I was a little disappointed by this one. Far too unbelievable to almost the point I almost couldn't tolerate watching the entire thing. The clencher was the shooting scenes at the Arc de Triomphe. Honestly, people continuing to drive through the shootouts was on the ridiculous side. Nobody in their right mind would drive through hails of gunfire.They also made John Wick more or less a superhero. When I see someone get up after landing on their back from a 40+ foot fall and jump right up like nothing happened is brain numbing. Ditto for the bad guys. The big dude with gold teeth gets his throat slit and three shots in the back yet can still fight like a madman is something right out of the Friday the 13th kind of film. I give it a 5/10.
reviews.heading: A little too Hollywoody for me

reviews.content: Please do not make John Wick chapter 5. In the name of god have mercy. Almost no part of the movie is real, if you want to see how people die they should consider documenting reality to create new movies. Rambo sometimes is funny well here not even that. Thank the lord I did not pay to see this fairy tale and watch it for free otherwise I would be looking for refund. Folks, save few notes and avoid this piece of nonsense. Wick is some sort of immortal character who makes others to miss the target from 20cm away, unbelievable, or maybe he has some powers that cause that, I don't get it. As much I like clowns this is well below the acceptable standard.
reviews.heading: Awful

reviews.content: If you love to watch hundreds of bad guys get killed, then the John Wick series is the one to watch, but you need to leave your sense of reality outside and prepare to devote all your energy to maintaining your suspension of disbelief.The most challenging obstacle I encountered was the way they exhibited Kevlar suits. Apparently the director would like you to belief that if you hold up a icee of Kevlar fabric then bullets... I dunno... bounce off?That's not how Kevlar works, people. The Kevlar might stop the bullet from penetrating, but it does nothing to mitigate the kinetic energy of the bullet.I watched a news reporter "demonstrate" his Kevlar vest, as he had a fellow employee literally shot him with a low caliber bullet from close range. The vest did stop the bullet, but the impact knocked him on his back and broke two ribs.You can hold up your Kevlar jacket lapel and the the bullet's energy will rip it out of your hand and, best case scenario, break half the bones in your face.Then there is the fact that all those trained killers seem unable to hit anything vital, despite the two or three thousand rounds fired. They must all be retired Galactic Stormtroopers.Then there's this dog that keeps killing assassins, but apparently only one of them ever thought about shooting the dog. Who knew that hired assassins were also animal lovers?If you can make it through the movie without shouting out "Oh come on!", then you will enjoy it. If not, skip it and sneak into a different theater.
reviews.heading: A fun watch, but the realism suffered

reviews.content: Magnificent, John Wick 4 is for me one of best action movie since long time.Casting was on point , City choices and scenery was on point.The movie was full of events and fight scene's.Just pure action & beauty.The manifest of John Wick through the series is behind amazing.The Director keep amazed us by choosing not only characters or killers to fight John Wick no, he find people with Charisma & background and he attach them to the fans.I loved every minute of it and i cried at the end to see John Wick last moments.I will miss you Keanu Reeves AKA John Wick.RIP ( Loved husband ).Masterpiece.
reviews.heading: Beautiful End for Beautiful Seris

reviews.content: If you're a fan of the John Wick franchise, you're in for a treat! The fourth installment of this iconic action-packed series is a wild ride that will leave you breathless from start to finish.Without giving too much away, this movie picks up where the last one left off and takes the audience on a rollercoaster of non-stop action and heart-pumping excitement. Keanu Reeves once again delivers a stunning performance as the titular character, and the supporting cast, including newcomers to the series, really shine.One of the things that makes this movie stand out is the incredible attention to detail in the fight scenes. The choreography is impeccable and the cinematography captures every moment in stunning detail. And let's not forget the epic soundtrack that perfectly complements the action on screen.But it's not all about the action - this movie also has heart. There are some truly emotional moments that will tug at your heartstrings and add depth to the characters you've grown to love.Overall, John Wick Chapter 4 is a must-see for anyone who loves action movies or just wants a thrilling ride at the cinema. Don't miss out on this adrenaline-fueled adventure!Fun fact: This movie features more than 20 minutes of new fight choreography, making it the longest fight sequence in the franchise so far! 💪🏼
reviews.heading: John Wick Chapter 4 - A Non-Stop Action-Packed Adventure

reviews.content: "John Wick Chapter 4: Baba Yaga" is pretentious, plodding, padded (at least an hour too long); the director seems to have thought that "even more" was "even better" after Chapter 3; I admit it is dark, cynical, stylish, grim, and sad - Wick causes death and destruction wherever he goes (robotically and almost unkillable, like a Terminator), even to allies and friends. It has solid performances that manage to rise above the sludge: Skarsgård is superb as the villain, Yen as the tired assassin, Anderson as the intense tracker, Sanada and Sawayama as the father and daughter caught up in Wick's fight.
reviews.heading: Too Much and Too Little

reviews.content: The John Wick movies are not traditionally "good". They don't have much of a plot, and the acting isn't great...but it doesn't have to be, because they have AMAZING action sequences. The first half of John Wick 4 is no exception. In fact, it's a Master's Class in fight scene choreography, that manages to be both clever, and occasionally humorous, in its brutality. I particularly appreciated their recognition of nun chucks as the blunt instruments they are. With the physics involved it takes 0 training to use them effectively (notice I didn't say well)- after all, they are illegal in the US for a reason. Any moron can generate tremendous force with two sticks and a string, and will be just fine as long as they don't miss. John Wick knows what to do when he misses, but he mostly just swings the crap out of them...and it's glorious.Then they jumped the shark. Potential spoilers beyond this point.Where they started to lose me was with a sweaty mobster with a bullet in his butt moving like an uninjured Olympic martial artist. Wick surviving a fall that at the very least should have been life altering further chipped away at my suspension of disbelief...especially since a similar fall ultimately killed the sweaty mobster with the inhaler.But where they really lost me, was the dog. I didn't want the dog to die. I never want the dog to die. But if you hit a dog with a car hard enough to dent it, it's not going to pop back up like nothing happened, in all its obviously CGI glory...and that removed all the tension. If the dog can't die, neither can the important humans. If the important humans can't die, there are no stakes. If there are no stakes, there is no excitement...and it's boring. And that, ladies and gentlemen, is how you turn what started off as one of the best action franchises in recent years into The Three Stooges. The whole thing just dissolved into a slapstick mess that bored me and literally put my husband to sleep.I will still watch anything Kenau Reeves does.
reviews.heading: They should have stopped while they were ahead

reviews.content: Honestly have to wonder when reading some reviews here if they were watching the same film as me.Without any doubt the best of all John Wick. A masterpiece of entertainment. Cinematography from Dan Laustsen is just incredible. This with some great Directing from Chad Stahelski and well paced and considered dialog. Some great lines delivered well from a great cast. This has to be one film to see more than once, just to take a second look at the brilliant fight scenes. Incredible work by so many on this film.You get what you expect from John Wick and then some in spades. This for me, the most fun watching one of the best action films made to date. Don't miss it. Brilliant from beginning to end.
reviews.heading: A masterpiece from any angle.

reviews.content: Wow, I haven't seen such a bad and over the top movie in a long long time. The amount of risiculousness and bad acting surpasses even some of the Marvel movies.For example, John falls 2 times from like 3rd floor height and is all fine and dandy. He gets hit by a car 6 or 7 times, and every time he just rolls off like nothing happened. The fight scene in a club is beyond ridiculous, with people just continuing to dance while they are shooting and chopping heads around them. Not to mention the ending with the ridiculous and exhausting staircase scene that just goes on and on.I really feel like all these 9 and 10 reviews here are just review bombing, there is simply nothing else in my mind that can make sense that someone actually liked this movie so much.Overall, 3/10 only because the scenes and cinematography are really beautiful at times, the music score is decent and that drone shot fight scene was pretty badass actually.
reviews.heading: I want my 3 hours back

reviews.content: One of the best movies I've ever seen at the cinema, perhaps only behind Lord of the Rings.There are three or four moments of action sequences that are just incredible. I found myself smiling to what I was witnessing.The movie was also extremely well shot, I can also remember a couple of camera views that were just perfect.Osaka and Paris were also very well chosen places to film, it gives an extra humph of culture to the movie.Great actors and characters, great acting, great production, and the best of action that you'll find out there.Honestly amazed, surprised and impressed from what I saw, and I'm so happy I saw it at the cinema.
reviews.heading: Absolutely amazing

reviews.content: As with other action-packed movies of the franchise, this movie lives up to the John Wick name with well-crafted choreography and intense long shots. Yet similar to its predecessors, this movie still falls slightly short on the plot. The story feels dragged out occasionally, and rehashing the similar stakes only make the movie feel less thrilling. It is only the sustained originality with creative camera angles, weapon choices and distinctive combat styles for every main character that keeps adding something fresh to the franchise and fixes the audience's eyeballs on the big screen despite more than 2 hours of pure fighting.
reviews.heading: Lives up to the John Wick name

reviews.content: This is a great movice because; stunts are performed by main character. The stunts does not contain fake feel or unrealistic. Other characters were all committed to their roles and they were not feel NPC or extras. Casting and clothing on point. Location of the movie and lights are all great. Camera work and camera motion were all so well done. Background sound and music perfectly matched the scenes.The narration of the story makes sense and Overall it is worth a high score because of the completion of many things put together well.Well done to casts and entire crew.Highly recommending this movie.
reviews.heading: Brilliantly Made

reviews.content: Sadly (for me) this is the first John Wick movie I've seen in the cinema. Had I gone to every each part, I might have understood the hype concerning the sequels sooner. This is surely an unpopular opinion, but the first movie allways felt pretty complete and satisfying as it was, with a clear goal, villain, action and worldbuilding. Though the sequels are full of awesome setpieces, modern action and more worldbuilding, it allways felt overly complicated. Well the fourth one made me understand. I still like the first movie the most, the experience of seeing this in the cinema just left me in glee for the entire runtime. I recognised action actors, stuntmen. The cinematography even during slow conversations is beautiful. The lighting, sets, music so stylistic. The action performed in choreographed long takes. Sometimes ridiculously long takes. The whole John Wick series is a loveletter to all stuntmen and action fans. An action movie done right, and the small screen does not do this series justice. You need to see those setpieces on a big screen and hear each bullet trough a propper sound system. Real locations, practical stunts, precise camera work, what more could you ask for? Of you still have a chamce to see this on the big screen, go and do it.
reviews.heading: Meant to be seen in a cinema

reviews.content: That lasted 169 minutes? I had no idea. The time just flew right by.Chad Stahelski does not pull any punches (or engage the safety) at any time in this gun-fu epic. Combat scenes are not moments so much as they are entire acts. The amount of stunt choreography that everybody had to synchronize to was rather incredible, and they continue to find more ways to entertain us with kills, kill types, use of weapons, locations, teamwork, etc. I caught myself smiling for minutes on end several times while watching it.Of course though, as I said, they really lean into it. I'm sure this has been true of previous films as well, but it is very apparent that John Wick should virtually die in every scene that he is in. Whether it is how he is attacked or how they fail to attack him at the right times, he goes at every foe like the bear in The Revenant with full adrenaline and no signs of slowing down no matter what he is hit by. And again, I think if you look hard enough you will find enemies who have clear shots and choose not to take them because of plot armor, but you can forgive it enough if you're rewarded with a longer take or overall longer action sequence. What I really loved was how many of these scenes took place at night with dazzlingly lit environments all around, and the music in every scene kicks as much *** as what you see on screen. I had pondered over why John Wick doesn't have a video game yet, but if they ever make one I have decided I'd like one of those top-down shooter games (similar to The Hong Kong Massacre, and if not maybe like the GTA:SA MP rampage style).I acknowledge this franchise for what it is now, but I still pine for some of the missing components that I don't know if it'll ever be able to bring back. After watching John Wick, fun as it was, I found myself interested in seeing a prequel when he was the Baba Yaga in his prime, taking missions rather than being hunted. Even still, at least in that movie he was absolutely feared. In Chapter 2, I still found him heavily respected, but it was in that movie that I realized there would probably be a repetitive formula to the narrative and movie/action structure (which still has yet to break). In Chapter 3, there only lived assassins and they would go after him without hesitation, which did is not how I felt the world breathed the first time around. They continue down this path in Chapter 4, while opening the universe more to different characters breeding their own kind of loyalty. They are all insanely fun to watch, and you see the cogwheels of the John Wick universe spinning with the future Continental television show and the Ballerina movie spinoff. Where they remain faulty though is even with the existence of civilians during fight scenes, they act as droning NPC's like nothing is happening around them, or they aren't there whatsoever. It is clear that this is not our world that this movie takes place in, but rather a parallel one.I mentioned the introduction of new characters in this world, and you can't not bring up Donnie Yen when talking about them. He steals each and every scene that he is in, and it's crazy because you wonder how a character like his could thrive in such a world but you absolutely believe it when you watch it. I will absolutely take more of him and Rina Sawayama. She isn't featured as much, but she makes use of every second that she is in front of the camera. There are plenty of others (such as the great Hiroyuki Sanada), but the point remains that Wick is relegated to this greater universe with characters who-good, bad, or for themselves-are ones we can actually root for in any fight. Keanu Reeves is understandably less nimble at his age than the others (and it's either bad acting or he really has taken on this John Wick role in his line delivery to hilarious new heights), but he and Stahelski have found a groove that still makes him the most impenetrable force around, to the point that I go back and watch the action scenes in The Matrix Resurrections and wonder what happened there. I didn't love one particular character in their big fighting moment(s), but they go for versatility and I have to give them that much.March has had an incredible run of theatrical films, and John Wick: Chapter 4 is no different. You will lean forward during the action which there is plenty, and if I'm one to go off of you will not feel the runtime. There is an end credits scene as well if you're able to stay for a moment longer. I would love to go back and see this one again.
reviews.heading: John wick: chapter 4

reviews.content: On March 23, the Russian box office released the film directed by Chad Stahelski "John Wick 4", a sequel about the hired killer John Wick, who is trying to find peace in the underworld. And I, being a fan of this universe, went to the cinema and watched it on the first day of rental and I want to tell you about my impressions.So, the film tells about another confrontation between John and his new enemies: an old friend of Kane (Donnie Yen), one of the high-ranking members of the Marquis de Gramont's High Table (Bill Skarsgard) and an unnamed mercenary with a dog. John has found a way to defeat the Clan Board and wants to end this confrontation forever, but the Clan Board and the mercenaries continue to hunt for him. Marquis has received an unlimited amount of resources to destroy the "Boogeyman" and is trying to kill him with all his might, sparing no one in his path.I must say right away, I really liked the movie. Chad Stahelski managed to maintain a special atmosphere, such as the first three films, and at the same time increased the timing of the fourth part, compared to the others.Despite this length of the film, it is interesting to watch. It is filled with interesting, colorful, breath-taking moments. It is immediately clear that a piece of the soul has been invested in the production.The whole team has done a huge and painstaking job. A variety of locations (France, Germany, Japan), a lot of well-shot and spectacularly shown action scenes, excellent musical accompaniment and excellent acting.As a result, I really liked the film, I would even call this part the best. I would recommend this movie to watch only if you know the plot of the previous films.I give this movie 8 out of 10.
reviews.heading: «A loving husband»

reviews.content:
Full disclosure, I fell asleep in the last 10 minutes in the theatre, so my review of won't take the final act into consideration, (but if I'm falling asleep I usually don't take that as a good sign).The action and fight choreography is really good, but even that has some flaws, they're really drawn out, and some attacks are too repetitive (eg; John wick gets hit by a car at least 3 times in the same action scene, and he falls down stairs twice in a different scene).Other cons include:
The man and his daughter from Osaka, were built up to be a part of the story but then never mentioned again after the train scene in Osaka (I get that the father dies but at least have the daughter do more).-The movie is too long, nothing against long movies, but this one didn't need to be this long, scenes were drawn out and too many characters were so needless if you took them out it wouldn't change the directory of the story.when the actions scenes were happening I found it funny how the dancers in the club or the people sitting in the restaurants in France were just acting normally, when there's a literal gunfight happening in front of them.
reviews.heading: Decent action movie, but not much substance

reviews.content: Chad Stahelski's John Wick: Chapter 4 brings the John Wick franchise to an explosive conclusion. The film follows John Wick as he travels the globe, battling old and new foes to earn his freedom. The film stars Keanu Reeves, Donnie Yen, Laurence Fishburne, Ian McShane, and Bill Skarsgård.This film has the best action of the franchise, provided by what seems like all of the stunt performers in Hollywood. The fight choreography is impressive and complex. Even though the film is nearly three hours long, I never got bored as the action sequences were very entertaining. Like the previous John Wick films, many of the action sequences feature "gun-fu," a mix of firearms and hand to hand combat. I was also surprised by the comedic aspect of some of the action, as many scenes have an almost slapstick nature.Another aspect of the film that was expertly executed was the film's cinematography and set design. Many of the fight scenes occurred in interesting settings that utilized vibrant and appealing colors. The fight scenes were also captured with long takes, showcasing all of the difficult choreography that the actors had to memorize. A certain action sequence comes to mind when thinking of cinematography, which was especially impressive. This scene was captured from a bird's eye view, similar to a video game and there were no visible cuts during this scene.Speaking of video games, this film improved on the previous film's shortcoming: the story. While the events of the last film felt inconsequential, this film returned to the franchise's roots, delivering a simple story with great action. The film's story is structured like a video game, with John Wick having to complete clear and simple objectives. Many of these objectives lead to boss fights, where the film's side characters shine. A memorable and recurring boss was the legendary Donnie Yen, who played an antagonist that you almost wanted to root for.My only issue with the film is a plot hole during the film's first act. This plot hole was that John Wick was in a certain location for no apparent reason. Unfortunately, his presence in this location is a very important aspect of the film.John Wick: Chapter 4 is an excellent action film that features spectacular action scenes, memorable side characters, and an entertaining Keanu Reeves at the top of his game. While the film isn't based on a video game, it certainly felt like a video game brought to the big screen.
reviews.heading: John Wick: Chapter 4 is a WICKed Good Time

reviews.content: The violence is so cartoonish. The man falls 4 stories onto a van, hard enough to dent it in 2 feet. Barely an issue. Every goon can take 3 headshots and keep fighting. The blind guy is an amazing marksman. The other guy uses a shotgun like a sniper rifle. The fat head honcho is an unstoppable tank.The whole plot revolves around deception and finesse and the big ending is him tricking a guy. Talk about veering away from character!And it's all for what, exactly?He could have been the High Table's boogeyman. The one that makes them play fair with their underlings. Kill the ones too stupid to fear death until the ones remaining realize it isn't worth it. Instead he changes... nothing. Except for seeing his friends die.What a waste.
reviews.heading: Highly disappointed

reviews.content: My (adult) daughter, who's the kindest, gentlest person you can imagine, really likes the John Wick movies and this one in particular. I'm always a little surprised at that, but it's hard not to be impressed with the incredibly well choreographed violence they are all built on, and by now with Chapter 4 that's the whole point. JW4 has not one but three outstanding set pieces to its credit: the gunfight inside a building, seen from above as if we're looking down on a dollhouse (my favorite); the combat-in-traffic at the Arc de Triomphe; and then the long fight up (and down) that staircase below Sacre Coeur. All of them go on past any semblance of realism, but again, that's the point.These movies exist far into a fantasy world of their own making. In this one I felt that it was starting to move into Tarantino-like territory: various scenes start out with long stretches of simple, almost banal dialog and only then erupt into complicated combat. Keanu Reaves as the title hero never did get much of a script to work with in the previous rounds, but here his lines have been pared down to almost nothing. However, he can get more out of a simple 'yeah' than any other actor I can think of.At almost 3 hours run time there's enough material here for almost two movies, and that's the main problem I had with it. It just got exhausting. I was ready for things to wind up by (say) the two-hour mark. And is the ending really the end? The thing about John Wick (unlike the James Bond films) is you can't really imagine anyone else but Keanu doing the role.
reviews.heading: More is better? But too long isn't

reviews.content: This is the fourth movie in a franchise which has been perfectly concluded and fulfills the intent of an ending, to leave the audience satisfied. My satisfaction isn't only that this long ride has ended on a high note but also elevated all the previous sequels that felt directionless. All the unsatisfying exploration that reduced the enigma of the original movie all comes together with this final piece of the puzzle and paints a beautiful picture that is summed up by John Wick himself, the whole franchise revolves around a loving husband trying to attain peace. In a ride with no time to pause for emotional development this characterisation of Wick by himself is dense enough to add sufficient depth to the character that barely speaks and doesn't emote. It's like a star that expands viciously and the unsustainable chemical reaction causes the star to collapse on itself. This summeration is the collapse that starts the process of transforming this ferosous red giant into a nicely dense white dwarf.The best aspect of the movie is that it maximises style in order to make up for its little substance. The sharp focus results in memorable villains and henchmen, stunning locations, and consistent pulling with engaging choreography that never feels familiar within a three hour movie or multiple hours of movies in this franchise. Cain being blind was not necessary, Scott Adkins being in a fatsuit was not necessary, Skarsgard's French accent wasn't necessary, but all of these gave style like how a suit styles a gentleman. I loved that you explore John Wicks spiritual side with a light conversation about talking to his deceased wife and meeting his family and friends who have a genuine relationship with Wick unlike his previous companions who seemed more transactional than a feeling of love and loyalty.The beauty of this movie is primarily based on two aspects, everybody wears a suit and all the locations were traditional churches with mediaeval architecture. The religious imagery such as crosses, clergy and candles adds real world elements that connect with the audience. The action scenes are clean and the top down perspective was executed brilliantly.The only thing that stops it from being perfect is it's long runtime. The substance of the film doesn't justify the extend length of the movie but the style is gravitating. A slight amount of fat could have been trimmed like John's first adventure in the desert, cutting to the DJ and causing a break in the action frequently and Nobody meeting with the Marquis. The final nitpick is there are an unnecessary amount of tattoos that conflict with the traditional styles in other aspects of the movie. Finally the ending is muddled although satisfying.
reviews.heading: A Loving Husband

reviews.content: I watched this with a group of friends and it made the experience that much better. The movie had great action sequences amazing new characters, and a pretty nice villian. The plot was decent it could have been better and more fitting. Even though this isn't the best John Wick Movie, its still reslly good and I defenitley recommend watching this. The movie did have a good balance of humour, action, and sadness. Mr. Nobody was an amazing character I am begging for a spin off. The only actual downsides are the length because at some points it feels alittle dragged out in some action sequences but oversll great movie 👍.
reviews.heading: Amazing!

reviews.content: Unpopular opinion, but this is my least favourite 'John Wick'. It's sequels already began to fall into the trap of having to out do its predecessor. Chapter 4 is no exception and does all but perhaps jump the shark.The first movie is practically a masterpiece. But with every movie we are shown more and more of this underground assassin society, to the point where you're asking yourself if they are underground at all. You have to almost accept that this world exists in an alternate reality where police simply do not exist, other than of course when it comes to Jimmy attending a noise complaint at the Wick residence in the first movie. John is basically impervious to pain or injury, as shown when falling 4 stories onto a car/pavement and proceeds to shrug it off. And a blind man who is equal to John in both hand to hand and shooting. Donnie doesn't have the Force in this one, or maybe he does, I don't know.All that being said, I love the fight scenes and the gun culture. The production and the cinematography were great. Loved the top down room clearing scene. That's why I'll always go to watch 'John Wick' and its spinoffs, and even rank it fairly high. It's got huge style and goes all out, even if it arguably goes too far.As much as I love Keanu Reeves, I believe the way it ended should truly be the end of Wick's story. Sadly, it's the end of Lance Reddick's too.
reviews.heading: For Charon: Friend

reviews.content: Great, once again, join wick movie. Nice views, good vibe, new ideas and this time also better cast opponents. Espescially the French & Berlin actors. Yes.. sometimes the shooting scenes are a bit long and not all the acting is top of the line. But the movie has enough strong moments to counter these issues. A movie that all John Wick lovers would like to see! Hopefully they will continu these type of movie productions. Do get some snacks and drinks ready because it is a long sit. However the pace of the movie is good and will keep you entertainted all the way to the very end. See it in theater!
reviews.heading: Give this man a gun

reviews.content: John Wick Chapter 4 undoubtedly proves a new wave of action- cinema is arriving. From a small budget to the beginning of a new franchise that has created a Cult following in the youth,JW is a masterpiece original story. Keanu Reeves acting and own stunts creates a new hype in the story. Actors and Actresses like Scott Adkins, Donnie Yen and Shimaza Akira deserve genuine gratitude for acting and doing their own stunts. The Directing, Cinematography and screenplay helps to make JW 4 the best one in the JW franchise yet. Critisism may arrive due to a long, unending dialogue between the secondary characters and less words by John himself. Yet it's action stays undefeated and hope to see more movies like this in the near future.
reviews.heading: EACH NEW INSTALMENT KEEPS GETTER BETTER

reviews.content: Before I watched John Wick 4, I watched other chapters of serie. My expectations were so high because I thought this movie was going to fill spaces in other chapters. All I had was getting more spaces in the story.In the beginning, it was nonsense John teleporting to elder's desert without hearing or seeing a damn thing about it. Then he killed the elder and we went back to real life. What I don't understand is why they bothered showing us only the adjucator and the elder about high table in other chapter if they were gonna kill elder in 1 minute. This thing happened again in Osaka. Looks like John and manager know each other but we don't get a bit of storyline about them. They just talk 30 seconds then action starts.The whole movie was nonsense/not close to reality to me. In other movies you can see the environment is a living thing, not a computer made visual. In like every outdoor part of this movie I was able to see scene isn't alive at all.John was like Oblivion NPC in dialogues. He was only saying few words. I know it's his style of talk in this movie but I think they abused that thing.All I feel about this movie is that they made it because it needed to be done. They didn't have intentions of improving an already cool serie.
reviews.heading: It doesn't feel like I watched John Wick.

reviews.content: I'm really struggling to understand why this movie was rated so good. It is insanely ridiculous. Unbelievably unrealistic. Bad script. Almost three hours with way too long (even boring) fighting scenes. I must have seen something different than all the others. Keanu Reeves was maybe talking 30 lines in almost three hours. Or at least that's how it feels. 1 and 2 was ok. On one point I thought I'm back on matrix. Always additional opponents showing up - but of course always just two at a time and in the same order - two masked ones, two in suits, and then starting again with two masked ones etc. What a pity.There is only one nice thing - even though you could consider it as a bit too much: Camera and light were really great.
reviews.heading: Utterly overrated

reviews.content: Pure adrenaline, loved it absolutely from start to end. This has to be my all time favourite action movie. I loved the fact the there is no vulgarity or any unwanted sexual reference. Absolute thrill and a must watch for Action Movie fans. A make believe world full of hitmans with their set of rules, morals and principles.Was there for KEANU REEVES and didn't disappoint either and to maintain the robustness and freshness in the 4th Installment says a lot about the whole team including director Chad.Fantsatic BGM and action pieces and last not the least the Radio Jockey spin on the final chase sequence."FANTASTIC"
reviews.heading: FANTASTIC

reviews.content: The new John Wick movie has a lot of good action scenes, with the first few being the best ones. But overall, the movie lasts a bit too long and overstays its welcome.Other strengths are good acting in the roles by lead Keanu Reeves (but honestly, as usual - John Wick's character is a bit dull and child-like, and lacks pizazz) Laurence Fishburne returns from previous movies and is a cool cat, and other entertaining performances are newcomer Bill Skarsgard as the young and intelligent but evil Marquis.My favorite performance though was by Donnie Yen as Caine. I really liked the way they wrote the character, as a sort of bad guy who still holds a conscience, and still has a sense of honor. The actor played this role extremely well, and I thought he definitely was the standout character, as well as the most interesting character and charismatic actor in the movie! Just stunning.The settings are exotic and beautiful, and the film often is shot as you would see when playing a video game from above, which lends the cartoonish violence to be nicely taken in the appropriate tone.The big negative is I do think the film lasts too long, and it did get tiresome near the end with too many almost seeming never-ending action scenes. That aside, its a very good entry in the movie series, though falls short of being the best one, in my opinion.
reviews.heading: Good action, but drags on for too long

reviews.content: I'll be honest, I left this movie somewhat disappointed, but I am still leaving a 7-start review anyway. That should tell you how much I both loved and hated this movie at the same time.The fight choreography is probably the best in a movie I have ever seen. I had already previously felt that way about Parabellum, but this movie eclipsed that by a good margin.The audio track is absolutely amazing. It's a movie you felt from the very first scene right to the end of the movie. Make sure you go see it in a theater with a good sound system. I can't wait until I can get this movie for my home theater.Additionally, the movie is visually stunning. Add that to the sound and it is a movie that challenges your senses.Now, the bad news. The storyline is flat-out lazy. There is no plot or character development in the entire film. They introduced important characters where the backstory seemed important, but they didn't even pay lip service to it. They introduced plot items but never developed them.Don't get me wrong, I never felt the storyline in any of the John Wick movies were Oscar worthy but, at least, there were interesting characters that you cared about where they came from and what happened to them. In John Wick 4, there was none of that.Specifically, here are some things that left me disappointed (queue spoilers).1) In the opening scene they re-introduced the Bowery King who they had set up as a major character in Parabellum but did very little in the way of developing his character and role other than that a 2-minute clip where he is walking in the shadows declaring greatness and then asking John Wick if he is "ready."2) The only thing you see about Wick's refuge and preparation to take on the High Table is him punching a wood board wrapped in rope. Then in the very next scene he is riding a horse in the desert. WTF?3) They introduce Marquis (Bill Skaarsgard) and nothing about him at all is ever revealed. He has some cool monologues to advance the story but nothing really interesting about him. What a waste of a great talent.4) They killed off Charon in the early part of the film so Winston didn't have to die. In reality, it didn't serve any purpose because Winston was just a prop in the rest of the film.5) The past relationships between Wick, Koji, and Caine shaped a lot of the actions of the film but they didn't even spend 5 minutes developing that backstory. They surely could have cut out a few minutes of fight scenes to do that.6) Akira was a badass in the making and other than the contribution to the assault on the hotel she isn't heard from again until a post credit scene where she all of a sudden mattered again.7) The last two scenes where Winston "took Wick home" followed immediately by a picture of his grave site were lazy. It's setting up a lazy John Wick 5 (if they actually decide to make the film) opening where all of a sudden he was actually alive intro. And if this is the end of the Babba Yaga it is a disappointing outro to an amazing character.In the end, the move was just 3 hours of fight scenes and virtually no story. That does have its own appeal, however it got repetitive and ultimately left me unsatisfied.
reviews.heading: Tale of Two Movies

reviews.content: From the get go, this entire franchise establishes itself as a perfect representation of the action genre. Similarly, the deeper we dive into the world of international assassins, we find ourselves buried in a brilliantly choreographed and edited action film/series.Where Bond falls short, Wick exceeds. While many may argue 007's loyalty to a rich story, its no secret the franchise has recently suffered from poor writing and boring plotlines. To further the uphill battle, the traits that made 007 "James" in its golden years (much of the misogyny and toxic masculinity) written out we find the 007 franchise struggling to maintain viewership.An assassin who has mastered the art of killing lets his work speak for itself. His battle IQ is prevalent through the entire series. The thesis for almost every Wick installation is that this mans work speaks for itself. Many high octance action franchises sell their souls to the editing gods and hide poor action sequences with jump cuts and cgi.Many series lose their funding overtime and over use CGI to hide a majority of their action sequences. John Wick embraces physical combat and elevates it with practical effects.
reviews.heading: An assassin finally better than bond.

reviews.content: While the first movie has serious characters and strong enough motives - franchise was dropping quality with each next movie. This time it's just ridiculous. Blind assassin. Good blind assassin. Characters from Burton's Batman. Astonishingly stupid dialogs. Undying everybody. Keanu Reeves aka superman. Lack of blood and gore for movie with such violence. Bulletproof hands. Bulletproof jackets.Universe in first movie was intriguing, it was dark, mysterious, but realistic enough. Bad guys were just bad guys, smart and practical. And now it's just neon comics with grotesque cartoonish enemies.Dialogs weren't a strong part in any of Wick's franchise movie, but here they're are just terrible. Action is good, but way too long. What will we see in next part? New suit with carbon nipples? Wick will rise from his grave? Fall damage off completely?
reviews.heading: Ridiculous

reviews.content: By making this film a 3 hour monster they removed most of the urgency that was felt in the earlier films. The action is stunning but the majority of it goes on for longer than it needs to and can occasionally get boring. Also, I know that he's supposed to be unstoppable but some of the scenes stretch those limits WAY too far (all I will say is "stairs").I will say that when the camera goes to the over the top view it changed from good to outstanding, but this unfortunately was short lived and ended with another stretch of the limits previously mentioned.Hoping to see more urgency and maybe a little more originality return in the inevitable John Wick: Chapter 5!
reviews.heading: A good film being held up as great and about an hour too long!

reviews.content: Phenomenal. The action is as gritty and phenomenal as the past 3 films, there's still some of the campiness and unreleastic bits of action like 2 & 3 but the realism is still phenomenal, the story is much better than 2 & 3 it introduces 2 very interesting new characters and has such amazing world building added in that adds to the franchise and overall the story finally gives John wick actual reasons to fight once again. The movie is amazing I personally found some scenes dragged on a slight ammount but it's a very minor issue because of how good the story is and action, 10/10 movie 100% recommend watch all the John wick films.
reviews.heading: AMAZING

reviews.content: I went to check out the 4th installment of the John Wick installments with my family. Prior to watching the movie, i have read many positive reviews and went in expecting to be amazed! I have to say the movie surpassed all my expectations and completely blew me away with it's awesomeness and record breaking quality of action! Any upcoming movie in this genre will have to benchmark against this epic movie, as in my opinion, it is the best action movie i've ever seen! This movie is worthy of an Oscar and should be recognized for what it has produced to the audience! Well done to the cast!! Outstanding performances and I do hope they come back with a 5th installment and keep it going!
reviews.heading: Mind boggling !

reviews.content: Just one question: why love scenes in general and female nipples are thoroughly censored everywhere but this blatant and sick violence is well exposed?.. and then you wonder why there is so much shooting and gunfire in the streets. That's what is being promoted in all these movies like John Wick...And don't get me started on the 'prodigal son of Belarus'... "facepalm"... Ridiculously stereotypical and simply dumb.Why would Keau agree to this? Why do people like it? I sincerely cannot find anything appealing in the idea itself. If I could bring back the time I would rather watch 'Tom & Jerry".
reviews.heading: The most mind-numbingly stupid movie I have ever seen.

reviews.content: I go into a movie like this not expecting amazing writing, dialogue, etc but for the cinematography and action scenes.John Wick Chapter 4 has some of the best shot action sequences I have ever seen on film. It also has some of the worst I've ever seen. There is a legitimate 40 minute action sequence near the opening of the film that had me begging for something else to happen. Then just as John is leaving, more goons show up and the fight just starts all over again...I have very mixed feelings about this film as the effort and style oozes off the screen from beginning to end. Some of the performances were even really good between the action scenes. The cinematography can be incredible! The opening sequence and shots of the sunset are beautiful. But it all means nothing if there is no substance behind it.The film's length is another serious problem. It is unjustifiable. I've seen these movies compared to games in the past, and as an avid gamer, I've never understood the criticism until now.Everything about this movie is a video game in all the worst ways possible: Stretching out content by putting meaningless side content that could easily be cut for a more meaningful story, just added to include more repetitive gameplay sections. Bullet spongey enemies that always miss their shots and fall with little to no thought. A main character that could survive a nuclear explosion if he covers his head with his suit jacket??? Falling from 50 foot drops that instantly kill characters that are not the main character. Hell, the last movie at least made it seem like the fall damage he sustained at the end required him to rest and recover...I know this is meant to be a ridiculous fun rolllercoaster ride, but once you do one loop de loop having another 20 on same ride with no break in between does not sound like fun to me.The pacing of the action scenes in this film somehow manage to make the idea of a blind man with a sword in his cane, being able to snipe people using motion tracking doorbells incredibly boring.
reviews.heading: An amazing action film that is somehow incredibly boring.

reviews.content: Ohn Wick 4 is an action-packed thrill ride that delivers on all fronts. Keanu Reeves once again shines in his iconic role as John Wick, and the stunts and fight scenes are more intense and jaw-dropping than ever before. The film's storyline is engaging, and the pacing is spot on, keeping viewers on the edge of their seats from start to finish.One of the things that sets John Wick 4 apart from its predecessors is its deeper exploration of the character's backstory and motivations. While the film still has plenty of high-octane action, it also delves into the emotional and psychological aspects of John Wick's life, making him a more fully realized and relatable character.Overall, John Wick 4 is a must-see for action fans and anyone who enjoys a well-crafted, thrilling movie. With its expertly choreographed fight scenes, strong performances, and gripping storyline, this film is a testament to the power of the action genre when executed with care and skill.
reviews.heading: GOOD MOVIE!

reviews.content: "I am Klaus." If you know the guy who has this Cameo in John Wick: Chapter 4, you may realize the only funny moment in this movie. Besides that I neither understand the imdb ratings nor the critical acclaim. NOTHING in this movie amazes me because it offers nothing that one has not seen in cinema before and on several other occasions movies have delivered action in a more suspenseful, more fast paced action thriller. But John Wick: Chapter 4 rather feels like watching somebody running through an ego shooter but that is admittedly not very exciting. The senseless and emotionless action sequences without any proper tension make John Wick: Chapter 4 a very dull movie. Sometimes the degree of stupid violence is really hard to bear. Especially in times like these, it makes you wonder, does it need senseless action movies full of ultra violence. I think not and I am annoyed that I went to the cinema for this movie. A movie the world really does not need. The end of the movie creates hopes that an end is put to the John Wick saga but I am still in doubt that this is really the end. Unfortunately the John Wick series is too successful. And I do not know why. P. S. The Berlin club scene is really a joke and nothing compared to proper club sense like in movies like Collateral, Black Swan or else, even Blade is better than this even though Blade is 25 years old.
reviews.heading: I am Klaus

reviews.content: John wick: Chapter 4, Looking back at all the previous john wick movies, this chapter in specific is basically all the three previous movies combined times 1.5, 2 hours and 50 minutes of non-stop action sequences from beginning to end with barely any break to catch a breathe in between. Keanu Reeves always ups the level with each iteration with the amount of physical work and training required to be able to do these fight and action scenes alongside the stunts.Really cool direction and cinematography choices throughout the movie in multiple shots and sceneries.Bringing back the mid tempo electronic music and the addition of soundtracks never disappoints as a beatboxer/musician.This movie is adrenaline.
reviews.heading: John wick is an adrenaline booster

reviews.content: The review can be shortened in one way, which is action. When you wait for several years to get the excitement you need from action movies, especially since there is no action movie that fulfills the purpose except for John Wick, here he is now to fulfill what you wish for, a movie that you may get tired of action and satisfy your instinct for several years to come.Great actor, an exciting and interesting story that you will not regret that you entered to watch, can't wait to see John Wick chapter five. Now I have to fast from action movies until 2024 So i can enjoy what is coming to shake the throne of action movies again.
reviews.heading: Lots of excitement

reviews.content: John wick chapter 4 is easily one of the best action movies that you are ever gonna see. Iam a big fan of keanu reeves and after a disappointing matrix ressurections keanu is back with a bang.The movie's cinematography is so gorgeous and huge that it demands our eyes attention to the screen in every frame. Also the performance of donnie yen and other characters were awesome. The drawbacks to this movie is I didn't feel the villainism in the character of bill skarsgard. He just felt like a dummy villain and his character is easily the weakest one in john wick franchise. And I wished that hiroyuki sanada had gotten more screentime.The end credits song An eye for an eye by rina sawayama is just so awesome that I binged on it everyday after watching the movie. That song should definitely get nominated for an academy award .
reviews.heading: An eye for an eye

reviews.content: No spoilers! One of the best franchises ever. They have to make the 5th John Wick movie. It's kind of too long but (it's 2hr and 50 min) but I enjoyed every moment. My favorite scene Is the fighting scene which was filmed in Paris. The movie opened $72M in it's domestic box office which was expected. R. I. P Lance Riddick. I was so sad when I watched him in the movie. I think this is Keanu Reeves best movie even better than The Matrix. It's currently certified fresh on Rotten Tomatoes with a score of 92%. I think it will be the best action movie of 2023.It's worth watching it in theaters. I loved the movie.
reviews.heading: One of the best action movies made.

reviews.content: Laurence Fishburne introduces the film by letting us know this is a continuation of the "Dante's Inferno" theme. Wick (Keanu Reeves) has determined he must kill all the heads of"The Table." After killing one, he no longer has to come after them, they are coming after him and anyone who might help him. Like the Hydra that goes a new heads every time one is cut off, the table gets a replacement every time one is killed. Wick's old friend Caine (Donnie Yen) a blind man who makes Rutger Hauer (Blind Fury) look like a sissy. There is also a bounty hunter after Wick named Tracker or No One (Shamier Anderson) who has a strange relationship with Wick who he wants to keep alive for the time being until the bounty get higher. Things become foreboding when Charon (Lance Reddick) the boatman to Hades is killed in an early scene trapping Wick in Hades forever killing, like Sisyphus forever rolling his rock up a hill. Another planned is devised where Wick challenges the Marquis (Bill Skarsgård) to a one on one dual, i.e in order to get out rather than play a chess match with death (Seventh Seal, Bergman) he fights a dual.The film starts out rather slow with just three men dying in the first four minutes. There is an Asian scene that gave me "Kill Bill" flashbacks. The soundtrack was great. You would have thought someone would have given John an apology and a puppy.Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity.
reviews.heading: Such is Life

reviews.content: It's the best John wick movie, i have seen. The first John wick movie was good, but this movie is different. For A John wick movie is was realistic and it was perfect balanced between realistic and fake. Only the last part at the stairs I thought wasn't realistic enough. That is why I am giving it a 9/10 instead of 10/10. The story line was great and the characters were played perfectly they shocked me once again with story. You think they can't make a better one than they already did but once again it was great. And again it's the best John wick movie I have watch. Great! I can watch this movie over and over!
reviews.heading: What A Film!

reviews.content: John Wick chapter 4 is a 2023 action thriller movie followed from chapter 3. Hitman John wick takes his final fight against the higher table. Nothing compares to the first and second John wick now there were excellent. When watching this movie in London me and my friend said it was good but the storyline was very weak In fact it didn't really have much of one. The movie was crammed with fighting and no storyline it was disappointing in places. Keanu Reeves is very good but does not say hardly anything in the film which is rather strange. It's not his best was far to hyped up it's certainly no 10/10. Although did enjoy it certainly won't watch it again.
reviews.heading: To Hyped up. Still a good watch though !!!

reviews.content: In John Wick: Chapter 4, the performances of the cast, especially the one of Reeves, action scenes, screenplay, direction and filming angles, sound effects, cinematography, story, soundtrack, ending, and tone are all excellent. They are made with all perfection and passion.Regarding the flaws, what I didn't like in John Wick: Chapter 4 is that in the story, there are some elements that made the story a little bit confusing and the plot missy. Also, I felt that the 169 minutes runtime was a little bit long for the plot.But these flaws won't prevent me from giving the movie a high score because it is true that it has these two flaws, but at the same time, it has all the excellent features that I talked about above in the beginning of the review. So regarding the score, I gladly give John Wick: Chapter 4 9 out of 10.
reviews.heading: One of the Best Action Movies of 2023

reviews.content:
(2023) John Wick: Chapter 4
ACTIONCo-executive produced and starring Keanu Reeves as the title character, John Wick, as he's attempting to get rid of the bounty that was put on his head. Meanwhile, back in NY, everyone needed to be evacuated from the Continental hotel, after it was revealed that John Wick survived the gun shot when Winston (Ian McShane) shot him off the building at the end of John Wick 3. With a new authoritarian bad guy, Marquis (Bill Skarsgård) taking over the reigns, giving the order to blowing up the hotel, at the same time raising the bounty to have Wick eliminated. And he does this by means of using blackmail, he employs a blind professional killer, named Cain (Donnie Yen) and it's not just because he uses a cane either, but apparently both he and Wick used to have a history with one another. And he orders him to go with Marquis's right hand man, Chidi (Marko Zaror)
to fly toward the Continental hotel located in Japan as he found out where Wick is residing, managed by a master swordsman, Shimazu (Hiroyuki Sanada) and his daughter, Akira (Rina Sawayama) alongside with him.So far the first one is the best, the third one is the second best and number 4 is a third best, and last is number 2 as the movie has way too much grey.Spoil
In terms of action sequences, there's just as much action as the other John Wick films. The ending however, is the most baffling, as viewers see the grave site with john Wick's name on a tombstone with no indication whether or not he had actually died or not. Both Bowery King (Laurence Fishburne) and. Winston (Ian McShane) look over and mumbled. And after the credits, showcases Akira pulling out a knife as if she is attempting to do something, because Cain did kill her dad, and it looked like she was seeking to make amends, while Cain was bringing flowers to his somewhat estranged daughter. Is there going to be a John Wick 5! And great makeup job on Scott Adkins as the killer Killa.
reviews.heading: It has the same amount of action as the other John Wick movies!

reviews.content: Hands down the best John Wick Installments so far. Incredible fight scenes, great storyline and colorful characters. The ending doesn't disappoint either, a must see!Has received mixed reviews from critics. While some have praised the film's action sequences and the performances of its cast, others have criticized its length and lack of originality. The Guardian called it "overlong and overstuffed," while The Verge described it as "unrelenting in every sense." However, The Hollywood Reporter called it a "pure, over-the-top action spectacle," and Roger Ebert gave it a positive review, saying it "outdoes its formidable predecessors in nearly every respect." The New Yorker also gave it a positive review, calling it "by far the best of the four films" and praising its "alluring and self-perpetuating mythology." Overall, it seems that opinions on John Wick: Chapter 4 are divided, with some viewers enjoying its action-packed sequences and others finding it too long and lacking in originality.
reviews.heading: Majestic

reviews.content: Who needs a 2hr and 40 min action movie? No one. Yes the action was good, but repeats so many times that it becomes so boring. How can hundreds of assassins not kill one man? Answer, not possible, only in this movie and series. How many times could the dog man have killed Wick? Many. So no other assassin could? Why would the table head get Caine to kill Wick when he knows he won't. You can challenge the head to a duel as a rule, but they only assigned a head for the first time ever in this movie? WTF? And then the head can select a replacement? And he selects a blind man. All Wick had to do was to stand on the side or drop down and he wouldn't get shot. I think everyone knew Wick didn't shoot in the last round, except for the stupid head bad guy. This is not an action movie, it's a fantasy.
reviews.heading: NOPE

reviews.content: I seem to be in the minority here but I thought that this was a very good but not awesome movie. As an action movie, it's amazing, but as a John Wick installment, I feel that it is somewhat lacking.I enjoyed the fight choregraphy and I really appreciate them bringing in Donnie Yen, but I find that , when compared to the first John Wick for example, Keanu's acting seem to be much more cringe in this one. His lines are painfully forced monosyllabic and/or one sentence answers that seem to be almost FORCED coming out of his mouth, and seriously compare his dialogue with the first movie and you'll see it's night and day.I also find that the movie has become a bit too bloated, with unnecessary fights being put in, with many of those fight scenes not necessarily involving John Wick himself, and a lot of plot inconsistencies are just swept under the rug (why was the Elder replaced? Why was he so easily reach and assassinated this time around? How have we never heard of the Marquis until now? What happened to the Adjudicator?).The film is simultaneously too long but still inadequately explains the hanging plot lines while continuing to add new lore randomly out of nowhere.The action sequences are still amazing, but now it seems a bit...tired, I may be wrong here but I found the action in the previous movies to be much more satisfying and punchier. In the end, I find that it didn't live up to its hype as "the greatest John Wick movie ever".
reviews.heading: Great - but not awesome

reviews.content: What can I say! This is the best action movie I have ever seen. The action scenes here are designed very carefully and with very high quality. The selection of the cast is wonderful.. All the actors played their role in the best way, especially Donnie Yen, who I consider to be the most important addition to this movie, as he added a lot of quality and beauty to the Action scenes. Also, one of the most important strengths of this movie is the soundtrack, it is legendary and adds a lot to the watching experience. It is the best movie in the John Wick series, and it will remain in the memory for a long time due to the large number of unforgettable scenes. Special thanks to the director and all the staff for their great efforts in making the film come out in such a wonderful way. Finally, this movie must be watched in the cinema to have the best watching experience, so if you have not seen it yet, go to the nearest cinema and watch it on the largest screen, and do not miss this opportunity.
reviews.heading: Not only the best movie in the serie, but it is also one of the best action movies ever... Amazing.

reviews.content: Whether you will watch it for the fantastic action sequences or you will be watching it for the story. Either way, it will not disappoint. It has some of the best action sequences I've seen in the series and in movies in general. Not only is the action great - the visuals and cinematography was also great. Seriously, some shots from this movie are supposed to be in my laptop's lock screen. Not only is the action and visuals great, but the pacing is never too slow or too fast, it's usually at the perfect pace for a movie that's two and a half hours long. The movies puts a beautiful, yet sad end to the protagonist's character arc and to the series. This also gives us the possibility of other spin-offs. Or a perhaps a prequel...
reviews.heading: A Great Finale

reviews.content:
This movie had some great action, and was Keanu's best performance among the John Wick movies. Pretty much everything that happened between fight scenes was boring dialog that dragged out way too long, to support a plot that was as uninspired as the other JW movies. Many of the fight scenes, although cool, were also dragged out too long. There were several times where the fights were poorly choreographed compared to the
previous movies, and it was obvious that his opponent was waiting for him to finish what he was doing.Overall, this movie provided some enjoyable action moments, and long periods of wonderful naptime. An hour too long. Could be (much) worse.
reviews.heading: Exciting and Boring at the Same Time

reviews.content:
The action of the movie is very fast and feels realistic. Hope it will be better in the future. I really love action movies so I really enjoyed watching the trailer of this movie. I hope the full movie will be very beautiful.John Wick: Chapter 4
The movie seems much better than the previous movies. So my personal opinion is that you all can watch the movie and enjoy it. This movie will prove a new genre of action. I hope you will like the story of the movie.However, the comment I made is entirely my personal opinion. If you watch the movie, you may feel both good and bad.I urge everyone to watch the movie.Thank you very much to the Director for giving me such a beautiful movie.
reviews.heading: Fighting Scenes

reviews.content: Just ... too much.Not plausible at all; some places more like a video game with all the bodies dropping like flies, in some areas it in fact I would say it was stupid.The special affects are amazing.The different martial arts are impressive.Loved the firearms handling.All the different firearms were an amazing sight for me.The scenes in Europe are beautiful.As a technical movie it is great, however as reality it is horrible, even superheroes at not this ... "invincible"I wish they had toned it down few notches from borderline stupid to at least to plausible.An entertaining movie that is allWait no need to pay to watch it.
reviews.heading: Not worth paying to watch it

reviews.content:
