I was rooting for the dog to get a treat. It deserved one because it was "well" "trained".Besides the "well" "trained" dog. This movie was a bore.This review was made in the month of April the 14th in the year 2023. In century 21st.What was this movie about?: Honestly I can't remember what the last 3 were about. I know I enjoyed them.This one was about people being tortured by the dog.John Wick plays fugitive but with many gun battles.The story and the production overview: It was boring. The only deeming quality was the Asian Daredevil. Wick got whoop throughout the movie.The Kraven the hunter character was one of those mixed unsure characters. He behaves one way then the other.I hated his dog. Kraven the Hunter was a dognutter in this.The dog being unphased after slamming into a vehicle was hash.The pitbull at the end was unnecessary to have in the movie. The movie was more about dogs than having a good movie.Genre: Fightin/shooting/secret society
Soundtrack: mix it was fine.Duration: 2 long hour of enduring a worthless mutt.UnHighlight: the dog. Very cringe.Highlight: Asian DaredevilWhat can be learned?: well watching serious movie was a good change from the comedic MCU films.Seems like serious movies are on the edge of extinction.Verdict: I was bored and wanted to sleep.
reviews.heading: Very boring chapter.

reviews.content: There's such a thing as too much. I know this is an action movie but its literally just John Wick shooting people for 2hours and 49 minutes. He never gets hurt, he falls from 30 meters and doesn't break one finger, pretty sure he shoots around five hundred people and he doesn't get one single scratch. There is no story line, it is just shooting and non sense. I dont understand how so many people like this movie, its one of the worst movies I've ever watched. I'm glad this sequel is over so I never need to waste 3 hours of my life watching John Wick's non sense. Very disappointed, they could have ended so much better!
reviews.heading: Too much

reviews.content: After 3 chapters of countless casualties I must admit I had not expected anything quite like this. I wanted to see it and I can tell you I came out very surprised and glad I could see it in the theatre. I was most impressed by the locations, visually very impressive settings and a brilliant cast that is not to be underestimated. It was long but well worth it and I personally enjoyed the first half more than the second. There is a strange presence of humanity, respect and even friendship in this movie once you look past the body count. At some point the action becomes a bit much but the movie as a whole is really in a league of it's own and worthy of a great compliment to all involved!
reviews.heading: In a league of it's own

reviews.content: After three previous films, in which the story, the action and the humor formed a unity, this farewell film feels superfluous.I will not fully describe the film, but after an 'Indiana Jones' (how this one is missed) opening, the film already collapses.There are hardly any humorous dialogues, but identical fighting scenes plague your eyes for 2.40 hours.It's impossible to keep watching seriously if all the characters just keep fighting after being fired at at close range several times.You have to dream along with a movie and not take everything seriously, but when the hero is constantly hit by cars and thrown down stairs countless times, it starts to look like a cartoon.Of course, I like Keanu and even look back at the earlier parts (particularly 1 and 2) with great pleasure, but this is expensive shoddy work. The fumbling with the nunchuks hurt my eyes: any 10-year-old child does this better.In short: Keanu played his imperturbable character properly, but simply fell victim to poor direction and a meager story.
reviews.heading: One film to many

reviews.content: After watching this at the cinemas in America with my Mum and Dad here's my spoiler-free review of John Wick: Chapter 4! As usual, I'll be talking about my thoughts, what I enjoyed most about this film and my conclusion/rating! Keanu Reeves returns as John Wick & he's fun to watch, Donnie Yen as Caine is Bad A since watching his fight scenes in Rogue One as Chirrut Imwe and now this, Ian McShane as Winston is awesome and even pays tribute to the late great Lance Reddick who sadly passed away from Ischemic heart disease! My favourite part of watching this movie was the action scenes they're so well done & very well choreographed! Overall I enjoyed this more than Shazam! Fury of the Gods that's why I'm giving this an 8/10! There is a post-credit scene at the very end so don't go anywhere until that's finished! ;-)
reviews.heading: Best Keanu Reeves action movie yet!

reviews.content:
POSITIVES:1) I've seen films an hour shorter than this which felt an hour longer. The 169 minute runtime absolutely flies over and that is down to the film never taking its foot off the gas
2) The action scenes are brilliant and are shot incredibly well. In fact, the whole film is shot incredibly well. There are several shots that would look beautiful as a piece of artwork
3) I thought the film did a better job than previous ones in the franchise of connecting on an emotional level and exploring the relationships between the characters. John, Winston and The Bowery King really feel like three lifelong friends here, and the deaths of John and Charon are both very impactfulNEGATIVES:1) Some of the action scenes do go on for too long. They're very impressive, but they become a bit ridiculously over the top at times
2) Mr Nobody never truly felt like a relevant character to me. He was always just in the background and his resolution with John happens too quickly without the two of them ever properly engaging in combat
3) I rolled my eyes a bit at the two main new characters here, Marquis and Caine. I understand that The High Table is supposed to be a worldwide crime empire, but with every film that goes by in this franchise new members of the Table are introduced, as well as new elite assassins for John to have to defeat. Where have these two characters been in the previous three films? Also, Caine's fight scenes just never properly worked for me and I could never properly believe that a blind assassin would be able to do those things.
reviews.heading: Relentless and breathtaking

reviews.content: I loved it, fully packed with next level action scenes. And I really mean NEXT LEVEL ACTION.However, for me it cannot hold a candle to the original. The whole atmosphere from the original is gone and it was too long for me.Having said that, I always love Keanu Reeves and this movie is my second favorite from the franchise.This movie is definitely worth your money, there is not a boring moment in the movie.Sometimes I wonder how many times a person can get hit by a car and still can get up and fight, but then again.... It is not reality. It is an action movie.I think this movie sets the bar really high for future movies.
reviews.heading: Good, but it's not the original.

reviews.content: In my opinion this is by far the worst movie of the franchise. It's just way too over the top. Everybody seems to have magical jackets now to stop the bullets.Audience loved the dogs on the third one so that just lazily copied one here also but didn't bother to have any real cool scenes with it.I'm happy they made John Wick 1 but since then every movie getting worse and worse. This one was already so bad that I regret spending any money to see it.People shooting and dying in center of Paris but police doesn't seem to care.John Wick getting shot, falling from great heights etc without any issues.
reviews.heading: I don't understand the great scores of this movie

reviews.content: If you want to watch fighting for 3H, beyond a rational setting, this is the movie to do it. I was well-produced, but it was almost exclusively fighting and shooting, mayhem for a long time, no police.There was really not complexity to the story. I would give the story a 3 or 4, really, just nothing really there. However, because the action was good and I like Kineau Reeves, I gave it a 7/10.Ian McShane is always fantastic, and Bill Skarsgard was a good arrogant villain. IP Man, Donnie Yen, was fine. The fight scenes were so long you could go to the bathroom and come back and it would still be going on, not missing much but more fighting.I am not surprised about the high viewer ratings, but I am surprised by the high critics rating, because simply not a lot of story.
reviews.heading: 3H of Fighting, Yes; Story, No; Want action? Here. Want story? Not here.

reviews.content: To start this analysis I need to say that I watched the other three films in the franchise and found them to be good films, not great, much less excellent, but this film was something else.Seeing this film in the cinema I had a very good experience, the sound in the speakers makes the experience something far superior than seeing it on your TV, so please, see the film in the cinema while it is still showing.For us to contextualize the story of the film, John Wick is seeking his freedom from the High Table in his last attempt to have his freedom.The story of the 4th film is good, nothing that makes it memorable or sensational, but it acts in line with the duration of the film and long shots of the fight, which in this film are sensational, with different ways of seeing John Wick's fights, with cameras superiors, different scenarios and lightings for each fight and different weapons for each fight.The technical aspects of this film stand out from the previous ones in the franchise, with great sound work and photography that you don't see in films of the genre, with beautiful open shots of the city and the fights, costumes similar to other films in the franchise, with nothing different and that production design that we already know from the franchise, with numerous extras with large structures.Already going deeper into the action of the film, I would say it is innovative, intense and sensational. Its long shots bring us a reality in the fights and the different fighting weapons like samurai swords, bats, guns and martial arts with several different scenarios for each fight plan.One thing that I would like to say is good in the film are its references to Lawrence of Arabia in the first minutes of the film, such as the famous match edition, the open shots of the Arabian desert and the clothes being a classic reference to the classic film.Already bringing a negative point are some absurdities of fights and narratives, but it is not something that makes you stay away from the experience.Grade 8.4/10.If I could watch it, watch it because worth.
reviews.heading: An Intense and high quality action movie

reviews.content: The movie was simply bad. To much over the top unrealistic action, to a point where it became stupid and to much bad written dialog. I dond know who this movie is for. Waste of time and waste of money. Sad to see, that talent in the film industry seems to continue to decline.The camera shots looked in most of the scenes quite impressive. That is kind of the reason I gave this movie 3/10 stars. Half of the time I was looking on my watch, hoping the movie ends.From the reaction of other people during the movie i got the same expression. Everyone was laughing at action scenes that weren't intended to be funny..
reviews.heading: Simply too much stupidity.

reviews.content: John Wick: Chapter 4 is an action-packed thriller that will certainly please fans of the franchise. The film delivers some impressive fight scenes and great cinematography that is characteristic of the John Wick films. Keanu Reeves once again delivers a solid performance as the titular character, showcasing his impressive martial arts skills and stoic demeanor.However, the film does feel a bit repetitive in terms of its plot and action sequences. While the action is well-executed, it doesn't bring much that we haven't seen before in the previous films. Additionally, some of the new characters introduced in the film could have been developed more fully.Overall, John Wick: Chapter 4 is an enjoyable continuation of the franchise, with some standout moments that will satisfy fans, but it lacks the freshness and excitement of the earlier films. The film earns a 7/10 rating for its strong action, solid performances, and impressive production values.
reviews.heading: A beloved husband!

reviews.content: Was rather hesitant about the almost 3 hour runtime, and it did become a factor. Let's just face it, the fight scenes are too long. No doubt they are well made, but it's just too much. Plus though for the variation.You also had to suspend your belief even more in this than the earlier iterations. Here Wick is superhero-like in his ability to endure pain and withstand bullets using his coat (?)Skarsgård as the Marquis didn't work for me, should have been casted differently. Good to see Lance Reddick in the beginning, he was such a classy actor in the first movies.The locations and sets are nice, and good to see that not everything gets solved with cgi these days.All i all, this was much of what you would expect from this franchise...perhaps too much. I sincerely hope we don't get a Joanna Wick continuing this saga, but that it now can take a well deserved rest.
reviews.heading: RIP Jonathan

reviews.content: I haven't read all the reviews, so pardon my ignorance if my comment is repetitive. I was highly amused by the director's "borrowing" of scenes from the movie "The Warriors" during John Wick's travails during his journey to reach the site of the final duel. Especially obvious were the scenes where lady radio announcer provided the play-by-play location of John while exhorting the mob chasing him to pick up the pace. It was such a flashback for me that I thought for a moment that it was the same announcer from "The Warriors", except she would be much older now. Maybe this and the whole final chase sequence were easter eggs provided by the director and producers as a nod to the original action-packed sequence leading to the ultimate conclusion. Then again maybe "The Warriors" borrowed it to pay homage to an earlier movie.Otherwise, a great action movie for the ages. I was exhausted at the end, nothing was left on the table. If in fact John Wick is dead, it was a satisfying ending.
reviews.heading: Borrowed scenes

reviews.content: Love the John Wick movies but this wasn't up to par. Don't get me wrong, the action is AMAZINGLY choreographed and filmed. All of them are. This one was just way too long and it's just insanely unplausible that any one armed man is going to drop hundreds and hundreds of assassins, even when huge groups of them all have a clear shot and yet most just wait their turn, like old kung fu movies from the 70s. Come on. There's so much non-stop fighting that it gets boring and you just wish they had put more effort into telling a story, building up characters more and building suspense and anticipation. Nope, shooting, shooting, punch, stab, boom, slash, shooting, boom, repeat, repeat, repeat, repeat, repeat and repeat. Wait, is there going to be a shocking twist? Oooo, nope. Repeat, repeat, repeat and repeat annnnnnnd, the end.
reviews.heading: Meh. Gratuitous violence and not much more

reviews.content:
It was a really good action movie.With a lot of action scenes ,
but my biggest problem with the movie was that We could not see any injury for 2 hours and 40 minutes. Then we saw 3 injuries on the body of John and still nothing on his face.In
He was in at least one accident with cars, and millions of fights he fell from 220 stairs two times and also fell down from the building onto the car, but he did not get any injury. It was the weakest point of the movie.It is a long movie but you do not get tired.I paid $13 on AMC fot it and it is worth it.John Wick died at the end but I do not believe it.
reviews.heading: It is long but you do not get tired.

reviews.content: Previous movies had a better story with more dialogues to make it interesting. Just felt like the movie was running out of ideas for the story and dialogues. But the action scenes were amazing shooting & fight scenes were taken to another level. Filming one shooting scene from above to see what is going on the other side of the room was awesome and interesting.Hopefully this will be a lesson for the producer, that people want dialogues aswell as action in movies. Not just Keanu saying sorry and you owe me... The dialogues were to few for today's audience to completely enjoy this movie. Story and dialogues are as important as action in a movie.
reviews.heading: Great action scenes followed up with poor dialogues and story

reviews.content: I rarely write reviews, but this movie is a complete success. It delivers exactly what I expected, nothing more, and nothing less. I felt like I was back in the 80's, simpler days movie wise. Thank you for the great movie!!!!As I need to write 600 characters, I'll say that the cast was great, Donnie Yen was a great surprise, I didn't even think I'd see him in there, and I was glad he did his quick punch trick at least once.It is rare that a trilogy is good (first star wars, indiana jones, aliens to a certain extent...) but to get a quadrilogy all good and not running on fumes at the end is a chef-d'oeuvre by itself.
reviews.heading: 10 out of 10 for me

reviews.content: One of the most imaginative action movies ever made, in a series of extremely well-crafted action films. Of course the set-up and situations are ridiculous, but the kinetic, deadly ballet is incredibly well-choreographed and artistically filmed - and that's the real draw. This film manages to continue to expand the neo-noir underworld milieu of the series without sacrificing any of the mystery. It also manages to increase the stakes for the characters. And while it draws the series to a satisfying conclusion, it also manages to leave room for more adventures in a setting ripe for stories and stunts. Truly a tour de force!
reviews.heading: Certainly the greatest fourth installment ever made!

reviews.content:
So the second and 3rd john wick movies were blazing electric movies that took john wick to unbelievable levels. This 4th wick movie was water down and embaressingly woke with a corney addition to the wick roster of assasins. Kane somewhat saved the movie at times but the movie felt vague and amibiguous with endless fighting and wayy over the top action the
that took wick to a level of absurdity and crossed over to ridiculous and clever or as cool as part 3. Thr crafty skills wernt on display in the same they were in the last 3 movie outside of one glorious overhead camera shot of wick blistering through a apartment building. This scene alone bumped this film up into the above average relm.
reviews.heading: Wick worn out and sluggish with 1 badass scene

reviews.content: This movie stands upto its genre more than any movie ever has. We see minimum dialogue and more action that not only looks organic, and sometimes even hilarious, but also very memorable, engrossing, and satisfying until the nth minute.All the actors did a great job performing the stunts. The same cannot be said about the sometimes goofy acting and the D&D universe-like dialogues. They knew what they were doing.Definitely missed some key characters. And some changes were obviously made due to real life death of the Concierge.Overall, I loved it, and couldn't look one second away from the screen. Wish the final scene was better written though; but still this one leaves options more open for the future of John Wick's character, while also giving a fitting end if in case sequels wouldn't be made.Sequel to that or not, there are thankfully atleast some other stories being set up in the franchise as revealed by the post credits and others by news. So we're definitely not done, & we'll be seeing more soon.
reviews.heading: Non-Stop Action

reviews.content: In John Wick Chapter Four, Chad Stahelski directed all four John Wick films as well as producing this time. The film stars Keanu Reeves from the Matrix, Bill Skarsgard from the It franchise and Eternals as well as Ian McShane from Pirates of the Caribbean on Stranger Tides. John is Excommunicado which means the high table will pay a good amount of money to anyone who manages to kill him. John wants his freedom from the high table so his plan was to assassinate all 12 members so he could achieve that however he soon finds out the only way to earn his freedom is by challenging the Marquis's played by Bill Skarsgard in single combat. The rule is that you have to go get a crest from your family but his family refuses to give it to him until he earns their loyalty again. He is tasked with assassinating someone who killed the Cadia's son, John achieves this task with ease. He is to meet the Marquis at sunrise but the city doesn't make it easy. People fight him in the streets, he gets run over by cars, falls off buildings and as he's going to the set location he continually gets knocked down the 200 stairs. He acted more like superman without powers instead of a realistic man. Mister nobody played by Shamier Anderson and Kaine played by Donnie Yen helps John kill the people on the stairs. Donnie Yen did an excellent job as an assassin since he played a blind man. When it came to the final fight mister nobody looks on just like the spectators do in the Hunger Games. It comes down to John and his two friends Kaine and Winston played by Ian McShane. They all want their freedom for different reasons, in the end all of the men win in their own way. There is lots of action with John killing 140 people throughout the film. Between doing his own stunts and being the main character in two big action franchises, this is what made Reeves known as an action star. Only time will tell what he decides to star in next.
reviews.heading: Action packed

reviews.content: Horrible ! 90% of the film is shooting and killing. If I wanted to, I would play a shooting video game. Where was the film for God's sake if we take out the shooting and killing scenes.No, "look for the truth and bear the consequences" and "those who cling to death don't die" type cliche words don't do it for me. I will not be surprised if this movie is sponsored by the gun lobby. Shame on you whoever participated in producing this.monstrosity.Keanu, of all the people I did not expect this from you. Frankly I was relying mostly on your name when I decided to buy a ticket. How can you go this low?
reviews.heading: Does the gun lobby sponsor this film?

reviews.content: For nearly 10 years we have been treated to the joy that are the John Wick movies. The nicest guy in hollywood has been able to reinvent himself into one of the baddest hitmen ever to be played on screen! The 4th installment is no exception.Ive seen a lot of reviews and reports surrounding this movie and the state that John Wick had found himself in the last 2 installments. Wick 2 i would say hes fighting at 30% hp and Parabellum around 1hp and still managing to slay very time. This time round hes back to full health and ready to take on everyone who stands in his way.With the sudden passing of Lance Reddick im sure they had multiple stories for his character as it sounded very much from the press tour that his character was going to be round for a while after this movie. Nonetheless he went out in the way that his character has always been, dignified.Less just say one thing that the villain of any movie deserves credit for making a movie just as epic as it can be and Bill Skarsgård is no exception here. Typical man at the top that gets everyone else to do his dirty work. Clancy browns Harbinger is awesome and a great addition to the mystery that surrounds the world of the hitman for hire.I cannot fault this film yet again, action movies for years to come will be looking back on this to create an epic fight scene half as well as the smallest of scenes in this film. Just one more thing to say that a fight scene between 2 factions of Ninjas is just as epic as ever before.
reviews.heading: We dont know the true impact this franchise will have for a very long time

reviews.content: Movie was amazing, a lot of action great scenes and cinematics but it is an action movie right?Have I lost the plot somewhere or am I not getting something about movies anymore?In which part of the word , Paris????, you can have a single gunshot or a punch and not be crowded by police immediately???I mean I have been loyal to John Wick but it turns me off a little bit the fact that it's loosing A LOT the touch to reality. Hour long gunfight in Paris, an actual European city, without a single sirene, people murdered with axes in clubs and people keep dancing while looking at it, until the scene finishes and then they go running outside. Many mistakes and telegraphy in the choreography of the fight scenes.I would describe it exactly as I would describe fast and furious cause they have EXACTLY the same touch to reality. I get it, it's a neo-noir , it needs this exaggeration but I can't stand it scene after scene.
reviews.heading: I Don't Get It

reviews.content: John Wick 1-4 are the greatest action movies of all time. John Wick 4 really ups the ante, nonstop action back-to-back for 3 hours. Cudos to everyone who worked on this movie, pure work of art. The cinematography is aesthetic. The plot is interesting and engaging with many twists. The action scenes are unbeatable, and plenty. The movie has exceeded my expectations, I couldn't ask for more. I attended the premier and left the theater with a big fat smile on my face. John Wick is the GOAT. I don't know how feasible it is plot-wise, but I really want a chapter 5. This is the first time I write a movie review. That's how good it is!
reviews.heading: The Greatest Of All Time

reviews.content: I completely understand the hype, we don't get too many amazing choreographed fights with really clear camera work in movies anymore these days. Donnie Yen and Rina Sawayama's fights were just wow. And some of the shots, although ridiculous, did look beautiful (I'm talking about the club scene where people were still dancing, while the dude next them got axed in the face or Wick doing doughnuts around a bunch of cars with endless bullets), looks great and cool and aesthetically pleasing but after a while, it does make you roll your eyes.It's becoming too outrageous that it's laughable now, getting closer to the fast and furious franchise, which is a shame. When it's so silly, you become less invested in the characters it makes the long ass fight scenes just plain boring. Where it lost points for me is; 1 for the plot, 1 for the dialogue , 1 for Keanu's acting and 1 for the sheer silliness of it all. It really took me out of the moment which made me feel every minute of the 3 hrs run time.
reviews.heading: If all you want is mind numbing action

reviews.content: I used to make fun of him. He talked like a surfer. He had little to no emotional stake in his performances. I could do a perfect impression of him. A dumb surfer who just happens to be in the right place at the right time and get dumb luck. But somewhere along the line this dude changed. I don't know what it is. Maybe it's that he just says less. And he knows a little bit (or a lot) more about himself. He knows his strengths and weaknesses. This guy has really earned me as a fan. I have to eat my crow like a good boy and say Keanu Reeves is a much better actor and understands what it takes to be a great film actor.
reviews.heading: He earned me over the years

reviews.content: John Wick Chapter 4 is another great entry in the franchise, with a few hiccups here and there.Naturally, the action sequences in this film were spectacular. It is still hard to believe that Keanu, at the age of 58, is still able to perform the stunts on show in this film. There is a great combo of hand to hand, gun combat, sword fighting and some insane action set pieces. Even though some of action does become a bit over the top and drags on too long, it still manages to blow you away.The production design, cinematography and lighting continue to shine through. The night-life shots and sequences where the colours are accentuated continue to be a visual spectacle.The film did slack on the narrative front. I felt that John Wick had no clear goal in this movie and was just going from objective to objective, defeating anyone who stood in his way.Also, as much as I love Keanu, I really did not enjoy his acting. I understand Wick is supposed to be this reserved, almost emotion-less boogeyman, but Keanu just had too many cheesy one-liners. I struggled to take him seriously.Bill Scarsgard as the Marquis (the main antagonist and villainous representative of the High Table) was okay. His character felt too similar to the The Ajudicator from the previous film.I really enjoyed Donnie Yen's portrayal as the blind assassin, Caine. His swift, ruthless fighting style really stood out. I also liked the unique relationship he shared with Wick. I also cannot ignore the crazy German kingpin, Killa (Scott Adkins). He was a fun charismatic villian.I am a big fan of John Wick universe world and the various characters that inhabit it. Therefore, I can say that despite its flaws, John Wick is still a fun and captivating experience which continues to push its action to the next level.Definitely worth your time!
reviews.heading: Great, but with a some flaws

reviews.content: I haven't written a review on IMDB in a while, but after watching JW4 last night I wanted to get my thoughts out there, although they are seemingly against the majority of fans and reviewers out there.My thoughts on the series as a whole are that #1 was something special. It made me and many of its fans feel something when we watched it. It had emotional impact and weight, that really was the core of the movie. Sure the action was innovative and fantastic, and Keanu was awesome, but it was all meaningful and heavy.Number #2 did a lot of things wrong that started the downfall of the series. The lore of the continental assassins universe was just botched plain and simple, and it lead to horrible writing decisions. Instead of John taking on a mission of his own will like the first, a new rule is invented as a plot devise to "make" him do something, which was pointless anyway because he then tries to kill the guy who is making him do all this anyway. Then instead of being an amazing assassin and figuring out how to kill the guy, he just breaks the main rule and gets everyone rightfully against him because he broke the one rule. It also introduced the stupid invincible suits that was the first step into fantasy and superpowers.#3 was a huge downgrade further, with far more ridiculous continental lore, terrible writing like having John do one thing, only to undo that by doing the opposite which he could have done in the first place, even more fantasy magic suit nonsense, and multiple massive injuries that should have killed him, like cars hitting him and falling off a building onto metal railing.After hearing great things about it from personalities I listened to, I had high hopes that the silliness of #3 would be left behind with #4, but those were lies. #4 doubles, triples, quintuples down on all the worst parts of #3. More stupid suit nonsense. A dog mauling people throughout the movie. Cars hitting John multiple times, and at least deadly falls off buildings that doesn't slow him down. It's as bad as fast and the furious now, maybe even worse.I was thinking about why it was so bad, and it occurred to me that you really couldn't parody this movie. Think about typical John Wick clichés that you could parody. Maybe having a joke of him shooting someone in the head way too many times when its not necessary, oh wait this has that already. Having him fall from obviously deadly height, only to brush it off and get up, oh it has that. Have him get hit by 5 cars in a row, that would be funny, oh wait they had that too.Perhaps the worst for me is the ending, and the writing is so bad, I'm not even sure its worth breaking down. None of the writing or decisions make sense, and it seems the writers thought they were being deep, and it seems people are falling for it at the moment. I can only hope that once the hype wears off people can think clearly and realize how awful the story is andTo sum it up, even after #3 I still felt I saw a John Wick movie and hoped they could at least do more of that, but even those low expectations were dashed. From a technical standpoint this movie could be a 6, but making this franchise into a parody of itself is not something I can overlook, and I think it needs to be called out. I was more unhappy than I was happy while watching this, which puts it under 5, and the more I thought about it, the more appalled I became, so in all honesty this is a 2 for me.
reviews.heading: Descended into Parody

reviews.content: If you want to watch this film for the wonderfully woven together story line, your going to be disappointed. There is barely one there. Ok, here's where I struggled. Why bother with a blind assisting. It's just ridiculous (I get the irony in what I'm saying here - it's not like JW is meant to be an accurate retelling of anything). And then it turns out you can call anyone out for a one to one duel and ask for anything you want. Seems like a silly rule to have. The bit where they're deciding the duel - what exactly was the point of those cards they were flipping over? And you could seamlessly mix half the scenes with chapter 3.
reviews.heading: How are people rating this an 8?

reviews.content: Have you noticed how the John Wick sequels gradually progressed in length? The original ran at an economical hour and forty one minutes. JW#2 just made it over the two hour mark at 2:02, and JW#3 came in at two hours and ten minutes. This one lasted almost three hours, 2:49 to be exact., and if you throw in the credits, probably the full three. It's pretty obvious why, how else do you cram in even more fights, gun battles, chases and such to up the ante in successive films. And boy of boy, did this one bring things up several notches! The story itself is almost superfluous to the action, but after a while it gets almost comical. By the time John (Keanu Reeves) rolled down the stairs for the third time, I wasn't the only one with an audible chuckle, someone in the theater behind me also felt the irony of Wick's miraculous ability to survive multiple assassins, falling out of buildings, and get right back up after getting hit by multiple moving vehicles. All done to pulse pounding music and incredible action cinematography, highlighted by that incredible dragon breath gun fight with flashing pyrotechnics. Lest you think I'm being critical, I do enjoy this kind of stuff but you do have to enter a film like this with some semblance of disbelief. And come on now, do you really think there's a body under that headstone marked 'John Wick'; there's no date for one thing, and the lengthy credit roll finally gives rise to a scene in which Akira (Rina Sawayama) comes gunning, er..., knifing for Donnie Yen's character. I don't know if the next one will be called John Wick #5, but if not, they might try going with 'The Caine Mutiny'.
reviews.heading: "Have you given any thought to where this ends?"

reviews.content: This is that franchise that doesn't take itself too seriously and just gives us knuckle-draggers oodles-of and seemingly-endless, well-choreographed fight scenes. Ironically, John Wick is a soft-spoken, sensitive and humble character that would blend into today's world, but somehow he still delivers on meme-statements like "I will kill all of them." I think that was how this episode's mission went.I believe there were 5 long fight scenes and I liked the last one best (without giving anything away). But I can say that by about 3/4 of the way through the audience was laughing and cheering the mayhem.One can't help but be utterly impressed with Reeves' Wick portrayal. The lack of filming cuts in the excruciatingly long fight sequences, the detail and the believability (in its own not-real-life way) is all testament to the craftsmanship and wll of the cast and directing.A supremely enjoyable thrill-ride!
reviews.heading: John Wick Chapter 4 was good. Really good.

reviews.content:
Eric's Grade: B-
'John Wick 4' is the fourth film in the John Wick franchise all of which are directed by Stahelski. This is the first film of the series not to involve the creator of the franchise Derek Kolstand with the screenplay instead written by Shay Hatten and Michael Finch. Reeves reprises his now iconic role as John Wick seeking to make the High Table pay for the wrongs done to him. Ian McShane, Lance Reddick and Laurence Fishburne all return with the notable additions of Donnie Yen, Bill Skarsgard and Clancy Brown. Originaly slated for 2021 the production was delayed to the COVID-19 pandemic, and 'John Wick 4' was finally released in March of 2023 to generally positive reviews as well as box office success on par with the previous film. While the door remains slightly ajar for a potential fifth film this seems like the end of the line for the John Wick character for the foreseeable1 future.This story finds John at once hunting the High Table as well as being hunted by them. To this end the High Table enlists Skarsgard's Marquis Vincent de Gramont, granting him unlimited resources, to dispatch Wick. He controls a veritable army of soldiers with a typical goon no. 1 at their forefront who is saved for an eventual showdown with Wick. Gramont also enlists Donnie Yen's Caine who is a reluctant servitor, but will do his duty to keep his daughter safe. Meanwhile Wick gets aid from familiar sources including the Bowery King and Winston. A new random player also hunts Wick as an unprecedented bounty has been placed on him. This new character is Mr. Nobody and played by Shamiar Anderson complete with attack dog companion which is very reminiscent of Halle Berry's character from the previous film. Despite the flood tide of bad guys thrown at John he wades through it broken and battered but still ready to fight for a final showdown with the Marquis at an appointed time and place for all the marbles whatever those marbles might be.'John Wick 4' is super-sized clocking at at nearly three hours, and it feels bloated. Wick is getting it from all sides, and when the story begins I have a hard time understanding what he is actually trying to accomplish. Is he seeking revenge or absolution or just a way out? With the High Table after him all he does is put people in danger wherever he goes which is made abundantly clear in one of the first extended action sequences. This movie continues to play with this assassin subculture mythology they have created. Here it starts to get a bit more wonky as they seem to twist the mythology to accomplish the story rather than setting their story within a mythology. The action is intense and extended as one would expect. It is interesting that the first film made its name with a very economical form of stylized action, but as these sequels demand new and more intense sequences more emphasis has been placed on the stylized aspect of the violence losing the austere functionality that initially made it interesting. There are some superlative action moments, but mainly due to the settings rather than the action itself which becomes redundant simply due to sheer volume. You can feel them stretching to create different scenarios in order to not make it all feel the same. The production design and cinematography are sumptuous in this film and probably the best thing about the film as a whole. The addition of the Mr. Nobody character did not make much sense and just added run time. It felt like they really wanted some more non white representation, and just shoehorned in this superfluous character who I never really connected with and was constantly wondering why he was there. On the other hand I loved Donnie Yen and his off kilter somewhat nonchalant approach to his character.If you enjoyed the other John Wick films there is enough here that you will enjoy this as well, but there is also the concept of too much of a good thing, and 'John Wick 4' enters that territory. The action just gets to be too much, and I found it hilarious as everyone is running around with these bulletproof suits which was a cool novelty two movies ago, but now becomes laughable as they shield themselves with their sportcoats like they are superhero capes. The movie has an overly long running time with a story that ultimately doesn't do anything with a more than ambivalent ending. The story itself didn't make sense for the character of John Wick. For two movies I have been waiting for him to go after this mysterious and seemingly unreachable High Table, and that battle never materializes except by proxy so based on that the plot was a disappointment. For what is supposed to be the final chapter I was just really hoping for something more. Something grand with an ending worthy of what this John Wick character has become, and I feel like the story they told here didn't do him justice and left the final chapter of his legacy begging for more.
reviews.heading: John Wick: Chapter 4 (2023, Chad Stahelski) John Wick's swansong is a lot more of what three films gave us, but doesn't quite live up to the mythology it wants to be

reviews.content: I didn't care about any of the characters. The world felt like a slumber dream. What is real, what is not. Action was poorly choreographed. Had no realistic element. I was so tempted to pick up phone or just leave, I've never done either, but also never been so tempted. I think if you are 13 years and this might be action-porn for you. The first John wick was solid, this was not.There is scene where something happens to John and that was funny. I don't think it was supposed to be funny. But I was too frustrated with whole film. There is scene which shooted from the ceiling and that felt like a game... idc to write anymore.
reviews.heading: Nothing mattered at all

reviews.content: If you didn't like the last three, you won't like this one, but if you liked them at all, you'll love this one. This movie doubles down on everything that made the previous movies great. I have minor gripes here or there, but this movie is an absolute treat we didn't do anything to deserve, and I very much look forward to seeing it again already. Soundtrack was great, fight scenes were great, the variety of environments and interpretations of combat were great (and far better than some of the previous). This movie is a work of art in what is otherwise an ocean of Hollywood garbage.For those of you who are interested, the references to classic literature (Dante's Inferno in particular) are scattered throughout as in previous movies and add some extra mythos and symbolism to most of what you're seeing, if you can pick it out.
reviews.heading: More of the Same: Brutal Perfection

reviews.content: In 2014, Chad Stahelski & Keanu Reeves brought John Wick to theaters and turned the Action Genre on its head. An emotionally poignant tale with stylized action like never before, inside a riveting world of assassins. In the sequels the action got amped and the world became more fascinating. And in this penultimate chapter of the franchise, the level of Action has reached a level that can only be described as "Insanity". Too many times I was grabbing my head in sheer disbelief as to how they came up with the unbelievable stuff that was happening. The set pieces can easily be included in the Greatest Action Scenes of all time. The Cinematography, background score, dialogues hit perfectly. Donnie Yen, Hiroyuki Sanada, Bill Skarsgard are perfect in their roles. And to top it off, a beautiful ending that completes this legendary franchise.Dont Miss This one..
reviews.heading: The Franchise that Keeps on Giving !!

reviews.content: Totally overrated how was this an 8.2? There is alot action sure, the acting fluctuating between good and mediocre to laughable and woody. Some the action scenes are good but towards the end the action becomes monotonous and just plain ridiculous and repetitive almost slapstick comedy actions like Laurel and Hardy . There is just too much overacting in this movie... The steps fall scene near the end is just silly. There are some very flat scenes like the card game scenes. So the movie was overrated, didn't blow my mind and definitely I won't be watching this again ever.....I am glad I didn't pay to watch it.
reviews.heading: totally overrated how was this an 8.2?

reviews.content: Im not a fan of these films because they are so cheesy, not good dialogue, Keanu Reeves barely speaks (in the whole trilogy) while all the other staff members have thousands of dialogues alongside them and Ian McShane has the biggest plot armor and why is John back in the desert? If he can just wipe out all members of the high table and not just one above and yes the people are right here it doesn't have a plot that's just shooting but just made it typical for the american market and i didn't really have the feeling that john Showing his pain just like Josh Brolin always shows the tank guy in this horrible remake of OldboyPS.Donny yen and hiroyuki sanada had been highlights.
reviews.heading: I have more fun watching John Woo movies than this one

reviews.content: After watching chapter 3 I was worried that chapter 4 was going to go down that same wrong path and be disappointing. But I was wrong and it exceeded my expectations. The positives of this movie are:The great , unique and fast paced action that is some of the best of any action movie.The cinematography which is amazingThe locations and landscapes which are the best from any of the previous filmsAnd the great dynamic off all the characters with each other.The only real problem with this movie that holds it back from being a 10 is that at one point it feels too long long and 15 minutes could be cut.Other than that I highly recommend this movie.Also you should watch this at the cinema and not at home because the experience in the cinema is unreal and it can't be replaced.
reviews.heading: The best John wick film and one of the best action movies.

reviews.content: Watched the movie and i truly enjoyed it. John Wick chapter 4 is a perfect sequel and on the whole a perfect action movie. Firstly i should mention the incredible fight scenes where choreography,camera movement and placement ,colours, landscapes and music contribute to make them unique and intersting. Of course that is the reason the first three movies had succes and thus this one succesfully succeeds them. The style and tone that is created via lighting,scenery,colour,music and acting is unique and aesthetically beautifull. The action varies,being rarely repetitive and it is easy to follow the plot ,(wich is an excuse so the action scenes could happen).On the other hand the movie ,(as expected from a john wick sequel ),is filled with violence and deaths as john wick proceeds to murder half the population of Paris and every assassin that comes after him. As i said it is a John Wick movie.On the whole for its genre JohnWick chapter 4 is a masterpiece.
reviews.heading: Perfect way to end the tetralogy...

reviews.content: If countless sequences of a man's brains being shot out of his head is "your thing", you will be enraptured by this film. I could not give you a number for the number of vacated brains... Earlier editions of this franchise made much more effort at story and character development. Reeves actually had some emotionally charged scenes in some of them. Sadly, that does not happen this time around.Scenes tumble onto the screen like a child's alphabet blocks striking a backlit carpet. We wait for images that add up to a stack of eloquent sentences but generally we receive "F" is for Friendship or "G" is for gun. And gun is very good. Guns seduce, they amuse, they dominate, they keep our "hero" alive. Uh-huh.Look, I like a well done action movie. How many times will a speeding car slamming into Keanu's stunt double excite you? You're about to find out. Let's say it's 3 times for me. It starts to become silly. If a department store's worth of shattered glass, shell casings and old-fashioned weapons are what you call narrative, then rush out to the theater and then please do me a favor: translate that into an actual story for the rest of us... Performances in this bullet-fest are delivered with the sort of monotonous, stoic surety that makes Groot's lines from Guardians of the Galaxy, seem Shakespearean in scope and power. Bill Skarsgard's awkward turn as the fashion-conscious, French bad guy was sadly not even laugh-worthy, just embarrassing for all concerned. Shamier Anderson who plays "The Tracker" manages a magnetic, and warm performance in a role with very few lines. His negotiating tactics are crass but effective and one of the few plot successes in a film that echoes the genre of gun-slinging westerns but without the charm and careful pacing of the best examples.JW4's musical soundtrack seems anxious to mimic the monotony of the "manly" dialogue. Grinding, thumping techno pop is the soupe du jour, soupe de semaine and the soupe du mois. Ouch! My head hurt after seeing this, literally. In fact when I got home, I put a mirror to the back of my head. Whew! Brain still appears to be properly housed. Thank you skull! No thank you John Wick 4.
reviews.heading: Some Ideas for a movie IS NOT A movie!

reviews.content: John Wick Chapter 4 carries on the story from where it left off in chapter 3, John is still on the run but now he needs to try get the High Table off his back. How he does that or attempts to anyway forms the crux of Chapter 4's storyline.The solid story combined with outstanding acting from Keanu Reeves, Donnie Yen, Hiroyuki Sanada, Bill Skarsgård, Ian McShane and Lance Riddick leaves you with a gripping story that will have you absorbed in it throughout it's 169 minute runtime.Combined with excellent action sequences, gunplay, crazy shootouts and fight scenes John Wick Ch 4 is a top notch action film that stands with it's head held high from the mess that Hollywood is nowadays. Especially love the scene where John is clearing the building room by room and the camera is viewing it top down like one of those mobile shooter games.I loved the movie, It's fun and enjoyable and it definitely deserves the 8 stars I've rated it. The place where the movie looses 2 stars is because John dies at the end and I can't bear to see him not have a happy ending after 4 movies of revenge and death and hatred and anger. So 8/10 from me because of that.
reviews.heading: Lights, Camera, Action!

reviews.content: What a movie amazing action is awesome kanau best actor i love this movie. Ultimate graphics. Every one can watch this movie with ours family. Starting this movie slow then taking turn to action then real fun. Value for money movie. All start cast done best acting. Emotional, action , revenge seen in this movie , Chinese star did awesome acting and action. Story also good enough. Improvement are needed in story. His Chinese friend great compromise for friendship he also did top acting and action and his daughter did great job and best acting and action. Chinese kungfu was great i am waiting for next john wick chapter 5.
reviews.heading: Superb movie

reviews.content: One of the most hyped action movies in an already packed year, John wick 4 had a lot of shoes to fill and a lot of fans to impress. It did all that masterfully but also so much more.Positives: Just to be very clear, the film has without any single doubt the best action of the entire franchise but definitely you have to believe into the stjnts else definitely Wick should've been killed by the first 30 minutes of the movie by the logic. The film is not just an action fiesta which to be clear the action is monumental good, it also has so much heart and story to it that some of the previous outings in my opinion had less of just makes this film all the more impressive. Keanu reeves for a guy of his age may have just given a peak movie of his entire career and it's some of the absolute best action along with some very impactful story moments such as Wick accepting his life or his reactions which are so perfectly timed they seem so flawless that even some of the modern great films can't compete to except a few.Negatives: after such a high bar set by John wick 4, it is also easy to notice that some stunts are just so over the top like the action is the greatest in the franchise but the stunts are also the most over the top of the franchise without a doubt. Along with that, I could easily see a better version of Killa not to say the one we got is bad, he's an intimidating fellow with power who's trying to hunt down our main hero and somewhere I see the cause that's driving him but sometimes the cause shouldn't be there. Sometimes you just need that pure evil T-1000 kind of part where even though he looks awesome he's clearly not the good guy, sometimes it's just missed in these kind of franchises.Conclusion: if they gave us an even reckless villain, this would easily be in my top 5 of favorite action movies of all-time but its still close, because this stuntwork and action is once in a decade level good and im very sure there will hardly be any films that can give the action of this film a run for its money as being the best action work of all-time.
reviews.heading: My favorite of the John Wick films if not also arguably the best John Wick film

reviews.content: John Wick: Chapter 4 delivers another thrilling and action-packed ride that is sure to please fans of the franchise. Directed by Chad Stahelski and starring Keanu Reeves in the title role, this latest installment picks up where the previous film left off and takes the audience on a journey filled with intense fight scenes, high-stakes drama, and breathtaking visuals.The story picks up with John Wick on the run after being declared excommunicado by the High Table, the shadowy organization that governs the world of assassins. With a $14 million bounty on his head, Wick must use all his skills and cunning to survive and take down his enemies. Along the way, he reunites with old allies and makes new ones, including Sofia (Halle Berry), a fellow assassin with her own set of skills and demons.One of the standout features of the John Wick franchise is its use of action sequences to drive the plot forward. The fight scenes in Chapter 4 are no exception and are some of the most impressive and inventive in the series. From a motorcycle chase through the streets of Paris to a brutal battle in a subway station, each set-piece is expertly choreographed and executed, showcasing the talents of the actors and stunt performers. It's clear that the filmmakers have a deep respect for the craft of action filmmaking and are committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible.But John Wick: Chapter 4 isn't just about the action. The film also delves deeper into the mythology and world-building of the franchise. We learn more about the High Table and its inner workings, as well as the motivations and backstories of some of the key characters. There are also some surprising twists and turns that keep the audience guessing and add new layers of complexity to the narrative.Of course, no review of a John Wick film would be complete without mentioning the performance of Keanu Reeves. Reeves has always been a charismatic and likable actor, but in this role, he truly shines. He brings a sense of world-weary gravitas to the character of John Wick, and his physicality and commitment to the role are evident in every scene. Reeves is also surrounded by a talented supporting cast, including Halle Berry, Ian McShane, and Laurence Fishburne, who all bring their own unique energy and flair to their respective roles.Another standout aspect of John Wick: Chapter 4 is its visuals. The film is shot by veteran cinematographer Dan Laustsen, who has worked on previous installments in the franchise as well as other visually stunning films like The Shape of Water. Laustsen's use of color and composition is breathtaking, and he brings a sense of style and elegance to the proceedings that elevates the material beyond typical action movie fare.In conclusion, John Wick: Chapter 4 is a thrilling and satisfying addition to the franchise. It's clear that the filmmakers have a deep respect for the craft of action filmmaking and are committed to delivering an experience that is both thrilling and emotionally engaging. With its impressive action sequences, deepening mythology, and strong performances, this latest installment is sure to please fans of the series and newcomers alike.
reviews.heading: John Wick: Chapter 4 delivers another thrilling and action-packed ride

reviews.content: I can see why people love it and I can see why people hate it. People want different things out of a movie and John Wick 4 delivers exceptionally well in certain areas while being mediocre in others.A quick summary is I had a fking great time watching it at some points and a little bored during others. The action scenes are fantastic. It's a TON of fun and really cool to watch. A little towards the middle of the film it did feel a bit slow and dragged out. Cutting out 15 mins would be perfect.Held up by good action and decent laughs is the weak story. I absolutely LOVE the idea of the underground black market, the continentals, and the high table. I wish we got to see more of that world. I wanted more backstory, more exposure, more display of how they ran behind the scenes. Hopefully I'll get to see that in the Ballerina and Continental.The other thing I think hindered the movie was that the idea of the high table got watered down. They started off as some serious group that mean business that you don't want to mess with. In John Wick 4 I felt like they were kind of a joke and not really as big as mean as people made them out to be. John Wick was just so broken in the 4th chapter. I know it's the whole appeal of John Wick but it does take away from the story and suspense when, even with suspension of disbelief, is just pure absolute absurdity. But that's also why I love it!I swear John Wick can take more hits than some Avengers. He's like a tank with the body of Wolverine.But regardless of what you're looking for you have to give it to the crew for how much work and dedication they put in to this movie. The quality really shows here. It's just really fun and exciting to watch. I rate it higher than the other John Wick films even though it's not my favorite just because in 9 out of 10 ways it's bigger and better.But I love the other John Wick films because we got more backstory, more Continental, and more focus on story.
reviews.heading: Beautifully absurd.

reviews.content: A friend from my poker game invited me to go with him to see this film. I was stunned. It came very near getting my rating as the stupidest film I ever saw, though, in the end, I decided "The Blair Witch Project" should keep that title.The guy must have killed a hundred people in the story, almost all of them with one quick snap shot with a handgun, while all of them were shooting at him, sometimes with submachine guns, but never managed to hit him!It is astounding to see such films attracting an audience, and sickening to see the high ratings given to it by contributors to this forum. Sad, so sad!

reviews.heading: Nearly Fell Asleep

reviews.content: The John Wick series started as a humble, nearly direct-to-video franchise that has risen to redefine the action genre in the 2010s til present. Most modern action/fight choreography in Hollywood at least owes itself to the Wick franchise and the incredible action design and direction of Chad Stahelski and David Leitch. John Wick 4 proves why their work can be imitated but not surpassed as they push the stunts, choreography, and spectacle to even further levels of well-shot, deliberately constructed insanity beyond any of the other installments.I consider myself a fairly knowledgeable connoisseur of action, martial arts, and stunt-heavy films, and while it might be early to say given how new it is, John Wick 4 might be one of the best action films of all time. It's certainly one of the best of the last 10 years, even beyond the other films in the Wick franchise which are all at a high standard.You have Keanu of course, the legendary Hiroyuki Sanada, the peerless Donnie Yen, greats like Scott Adkins (in an unforgettable role) and Marko Zaror, as well as the always excellent Ian McShane, Laurence Fishburne, Bill Skarsgaard, Clancy Brown and the gone-too-soon, classy and distinguished Lance Reddick, who always brought a level of distinction, refinement, and commitment to every project he touched. Newcomers Shamier Anderson and singer Rina Sawayama are also excellent additions to the franchise and bring a level of freshness and energy to each of their roles as well.John Wick 4 is long, it's not a quick watch. That's one of the main flaws I can point to for the film. The issue is that there's so many satisfying action scenes that are so well set-up, it's tough to think of what you'd cut out. I can see why the finished cut was damn near 3 hours, which is a long time for a shoot-em-up with this straightforward of a plot.For action fans, this demands to be seen at least twice. There's too many high-quality action scenes for it to be viewed once, so many well-made battles and set pieces all packed into one movie.A single scene from John Wick 4 would be another film's action climax. Most movies are lucky to have even two sequences as well-designed as what you'll see here, much less an entire film of them.The John Wick films also ooze style, with beautiful locations in Saudi Arabia, Japan, NYC, what appeared briefly to be London, and France. The lighting, particularly the Osaka scenes, is stunning. Stahelski is more than just an action director and knows how to make a gorgeous looking film that fills the big screen, where it should be seen.The John Wick films aren't supposed to be realistic, they're action-spectacle and stuntwork taken to its absolute limit. They exist in a parallel, comic book-universe, so I can waive any criticisms about lack of realism or the more out-there elements. Realism isn't the only point of action films, it's the intensity, the feeling watching it gives you, and the craft that goes into making it.Even the incidental kills John Wick does on nameless goons are well-choreographed. Nothing is lazy or done the easy way.Other action productions should be looking at this and sweating, because they've raised the bar yet again. In the next year or two, you're going to see a lot of choreography that will imitate this, and it won't quite ring as true, won't quite have the same authenticity.Kudos to Stahelski, Leitch, Keanu, and the rest of the incredible stunt team for piecing together a masterpiece of action. This could be a quality finishing point for the franchise, but would I be in the mood for another outing for Mr. Wick? To quote the man himself: ".... Yeah."

reviews.heading: 3 hours without sense

reviews.content: After an atmospheric and enigmatic opening that successfully builds hype for what's to come, 'John Wick: Chapter 4 (2023)' slows down quite significantly while it sets up its key players and prepares to eventually blow your socks off (and rest assured it does eventually blow them off). At almost three hours in length, the picture does feel a little too long for its own good. At the same time, though, there isn't really anything specific that could be cut. I suppose the non-action elements could be tightened up slightly, as the plotting is undeniably a bit loose in the first half and none of the dialogue scenes come close to replicating the sheer awesomeness of those in the original. The story doesn't properly kick in until just under halfway through, actually. That's not to say the initial movement is especially bad in any significant way, just that it's where the pacing is at its least propulsive and is the one area that could've been trimmed slightly. Generally speaking, the narrative is about as successful as that of the third entry, except it has a higher level of thematic resonance and its characters undergo more distinct arcs. Once the plot kicks in proper, it's actually a really satisfying way of driving the action right the way through to the surprisingly poignant finale. In a deft move, the ending opts for suspense over exhilaration and is all the more impressive because of it, providing an edge-of-your-seat thrill that's especially subversive considering the relentless pacing of almost every other set-piece. Speaking of edge-of-your-seat thrills, the final hour of this is an absolute masterpiece. It represents action cinema at its finest, a series of near back-to-back gunfights, car chases, judo throws, dog attacks, stair climbs and tactical reloads. The earlier action is also fantastic, particularly a mid-point club sequence that features the series' most creative kill since the second chapter showed us what a pencil can do in the right hands, but this last movement is a veritably phenomenal slice of pure cinema, astounding in its pulse-pounding choreography and confident construction. The stunts are seriously impressive, and the comedic timings are equally as impeccable. Its sense of irony is what makes it as enjoyable as it is, breaking through the unbridled brutality of its protagonist's tireless kill spree to remind you that this is an intricate dance designed to entertain rather than horrify. It's ridiculous by choice, a gorgeously lit opera of violence that drops your jaw as often as it widens your eyes. The extended set-pieces always manage to last far longer than you expect them to without ever outstaying their welcome, evolving just when they threaten to feel obsolete. The sheer brilliance of it all is almost numbing; it's easy to forget just how amazing even the simplest of it truly is. The first few action scenes aren't as gripping as they potentially could be, primarily because the narrative doesn't take off until the halfway point (as I mentioned before). When everything finally comes together, though, it's absolutely divine. There's stuff here I never thought I'd see on screen, things that make even the most outrageous action of the previous pictures seem certifiably quaint. It's an absolute blast that only gets better the more I think about it. If this really is the end of Mr. Wick's vengeful saga, then it's a heck of a note to go out on.

Great action movies are not about getting shot over 5000 times, Hit by cars and falling down 400 steps without a scratch!
reviews.heading: Ridiculous!this movie just killed all the John Wick action

reviews.content: John Wick 4 is the latest installment of the popular action franchise starring Keanu Reeves as the unstoppable assassin. The movie follows Wick as he tries to clear his name and defeat a new enemy, Marquis, who has taken over the High Table, the organization that rules the underworld. Along the way, Wick faces old friends and foes, travels across the globe, and engages in spectacular fight scenes.The movie is a feast for action fans, as it delivers some of the most impressive and inventive action sequences ever seen on screen. The choreography, cinematography, and sound design are all top-notch, creating a visceral and thrilling experience. Keanu Reeves is charismatic and convincing as Wick, showing both his physical prowess and his emotional vulnerability. The supporting cast is also excellent, with Donnie Yen, Laurence Fishburne, Hiroyuki Sanada, and Bill Skarsgard among the standouts.However, the movie is not without its flaws. The plot is thin and convoluted, relying on a lot of exposition and contrivances to move the story forward. The movie also suffers from being too long and overstuffed, as it tries to cram in too many characters, locations, and subplots. Some of the scenes drag on for too long, losing their impact and excitement. The movie also lacks a sense of finality, as it sets up potential spin-offs and sequels instead of giving a satisfying conclusion.Overall, John Wick 4 is a highly entertaining action film that showcases Keanu Reeves' star power and skill. It is not a perfect film, but it is a fun and exhilarating ride that will keep you on the edge of your seat. If you are a fan of the franchise or of action movies in general, you will enjoy John Wick 4.
reviews.heading: BEST JHON WICK MOVIE

reviews.heading: Visual feast and artistic fights

reviews.content: Probably the benchmark modern action movie that every other would aspire to look up to from now on. From the cinematography to the soundtrack, this is truly on another level. The story is gripping and the ending is really satisfactory.It is remarkable how tight the dialogue is. Like really tight, no unnecessary word is spoken by our main character. And yet the movie is clear to follow through, with the motivations, emotional toll and stakes of each character being clear to the audience.Surely no movie is perfect and there are details that could be better for the perfectionist, but this is action to the next level. Exiting for the future of action movies that might try to match or improve on this one.This movie is truly a must see!
reviews.heading: The new benchmark for action movies

reviews.content: As with every John Wick movie, this one has a thin story, lots of cliches, stereotypical characters (even the blind warrior is here!). But just as the first 3 movies, it does not matter. The story works well enough to make sense of the amazing fight scenes that we all want to see. Again many (maybe a hundred or more, you will not keep track of it) trained fighters die to the hands of John Wick and his colleagues. Japanese swords, a beautiful scene filmed from top down involving incendiary shotgun ammunition, another equal parts cute and deadly dog, an amazing car scene and much more. The choreography was on point again, although some of the armored foes looked a bit goofy while obviously not hitting the old man Keanu to not ruin the scene. The blind guy (played by Donnie Yen!) was a bit too good at feeling his surroundings, very much like Daredevil. His movements and fights were on par with every scene Donnie is in, though. Overall, the best movie you can see right now if you like over the top, martial art-style shooting and stabbing of countless nobodies. Don't think too hard about the story and the absence of police after minutes of intense shootings in the middle of metropolitan cities and you will enjoy it!
